harundo: <entryFree id="n20265" type="main" key="ha^rundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hărundo</orth> (better than <orth extent="full" lang="la">ărundo</orth>, Bramb. s. v.; Wagn. Orthog. <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> p. 441</bibl>; R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Prol. Verg. p. 422</bibl>, though the latter is freq. in MSS. and edd.; <sense id="n20265.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; perh. from root ar-, to set in motion; Sanscr. aras, swift; aranjas, a wood, as that which grows; cf.: ulmus, ulva, alnus, Corss. Ausspr. 1, 530 sq.</etym>. </sense><sense id="n20265.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">the reed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cane</hi> (taller than canna; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: culmus, calamus, stipula),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 64, § 156</bibl> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">intus medullam sabuci (habent) ... inanitatem harundines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 22, 42, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longa parvae sub arundine cannae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvialis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 414</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">used for covering or thatching huts and houses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 64, § 156</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 1, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. in encampments: casae ex harundinibus textae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 27, 3</bibl></cit> Weissenb.: <cit><quote lang="la">teneris harundinum radicibus contusis equos alere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:58:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 58, 3</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">arundo vento agitata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 11, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arundinem quassatam non confringet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:Matt. 12:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Matt. 12, 20</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n20265.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> of any thing made of reed or cane. </sense><sense id="n20265.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A fishing-rod</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hisce hami atque haec harundines sunt nobis quaestu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec laqueo volucres, hacc captat arundine pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:23" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 6, 23</bibl></cit> <cb n="HARU" /> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">hos aliquis tremula, dum captat arundine pisces, vidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 217</bibl></cit> Merk.; 13, 293; 14, 651.—</sense><sense id="n20265.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Limed twigs for catching birds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parati aucupes cum harundinibus fuerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 40, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres, quas textis harundinibus peritus artifex tetigit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 109, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantu fallitur ales, callida dum tacita crescit harundo manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:218:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 218, 2</bibl></cit> Schneidewin: <cit><quote lang="la">aut (si) crescente levis traheretur arundine praeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:54:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 54, 3</bibl></cit> id.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut qui viscatos populatur arundine lucos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:674" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 674</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundine sumptā Faunus plumoso sum deus aucupio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 2, 33.—</sense><sense id="n20265.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A wreath</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crown</hi> made of reeds; <cit><quote lang="la">as the head of Priapus: ast inportunas volucres in vertice harundo terret fixa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 6</bibl></cit> B. and K.; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Orell. ad loc.—Esp. worn by river deities: (Tiberini) crines umbrosa tegebat harundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 34</bibl></cit> Rib.; <cit><quote lang="la">of the river Calydonius: inornatos redimitus arundine crines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subita cur pulcher arundine crines velat Hylas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:218" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Glaucus) caputque redimitus arundine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:Pat. 2:83" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> Pat. 2, 83</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of the Tiber: et arundinis altae concolor in viridi fluitabat silva capillo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Paneg. Anthem. 333</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velatus harundine glauca Mincius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 205</bibl></cit> Rib.—</sense><sense id="n20265.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The shaft of an arrow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod fugat obtusum est, et habet sub arundine plumbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 471</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennaque citatior ibat quae redit in pugnas fugientis arundine Parthi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:12" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 5, 2</bibl>.—Hence (pars pro toto), <hi rend="ital">an arrow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inque cor hamata percussit arundine Ditem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 384</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 382</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 526</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 325: haeret lateri letalis harundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 73</bibl></cit> Rib. (Forbig. and Conington, arundo); <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 499</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20265.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A pen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neve notet lusus tristis harundo tuos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:3:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inque manus chartae, nodosaque venit harundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 11</bibl></cit>. The best came from Cnidus: <cit><quote lang="la">Cnidia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 7, 49</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">Acidalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:14:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 14, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20265.8" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A reed pipe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shepherd's pipe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pan-pipes</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">su/rigc</foreign> (an instrument made of several reeds, fastened together with wax, each successive reed somewhat shorter than the preceding): <cit><quote lang="la">junctisque canendo vincere arundinibus servantia lumina temptat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:684" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 684</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:707" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 707</bibl> sq.; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 154: agrestem tenui meditabor harundine Musam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">compacta solitum modulatur harundine carmen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cul. 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec crepuit fissa me propter harundine custos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 25.—</sense><sense id="n20265.9" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A flute</hi> (made of the <foreign lang="greek">ka/lamos au)lhtiko/s</foreign>, Theophr. 4, 12): <cit><quote lang="la">Satyri reminiscitur alter, quem Tritoniaca Latoüs arundine victum affecit poena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 384</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20265.10" n="H" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A comb made of reed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which brought the threads of the web into their place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stamen secernit arundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20265.11" n="K" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A reed for brushing down cobwebs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecferte huc scopas semulque harundinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20265.12" n="L" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of transverse bar along which vines were trained</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugorum genera fere quatuor, ... harundo, ut in Arpino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:8:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20265.13" n="M" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A rod</hi> (for beating, punishing): <cit><quote lang="la">ac me iterum in cellam perduxit, et harundinem ab ostio rapuit iterumque mulcavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 134</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20265.14" n="N" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Splints</hi> for holding together injured parts of the body, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 80</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20265.15" n="O" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A measuring-rod</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 826</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20265.16" n="P" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A hobbyhorse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cane-horse</hi>, as a child's plaything: <cit><quote lang="la">equitare in harundine longa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 248</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non erubuit (Socrates) cum, interposita arundine cruribus suis, cum parvulis filiolis ludens, ab Alcibiade risus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 8</bibl></cit> ext. 1.</sense></entryFree>
harundulatio: <entryFree id="n20266" type="main" key="ha^rundu^la_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hărundŭlātio</orth>, v. harundinatio.</entryFree>
haruspex: <entryFree id="n20267" type="main" key="ha^ruspex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăruspex</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ar-</orth>), <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. hirā, entrails; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xola/des, xordh/</foreign>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">hariolus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 202 sq" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 202 sq.</bibl></cit></etym>, <sense id="n20267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a soothsayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diviner among the Etruscans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who foretold future events from the inspection of the entrails of victims;</hi> from this people they were introduced among the Romans (syn.: hariolus, augur, auspex, extispex). </sense><sense id="n20267.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">haruspices mitte omnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim habet haruspex, cur pulmo incisus etiam in bonis extis dirimat tempus et proferat diem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:39:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 39, 85</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Etrusci haruspices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:35:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 35, 75</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:5:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum haruspices ex tota Etruria convenissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrrhenae gentis haruspex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:577" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 577</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (annum) saepe ex prodigiis haruspices respondissent bello civili cruentum fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 47</bibl></cit>, <cb n="HAST" /> 2; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Mario per hostias dis supplicanti magna atque mirabilia portendi haruspex dixerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 63:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 63, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum sacra secundus haruspex Nuntiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:739" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 739</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signaque ferre jubent: retinet longaevus haruspex Fata canens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 498</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui de salute principis vel de summa rei publicae haruspices consulit, cum eo qui responderit, capite punitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 21, 3</bibl></cit>. Cf., on the haruspices, O. Müll. Etrusk. 2, p. 6 sq.—</sense><sense id="n20267.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., <hi rend="ital">a prophet</hi> in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam patriae sim vanus haruspex, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 13</bibl></cit> (4, 12), 59: <cit><quote lang="la">Armenius vel Commagenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:550" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 550</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
haruspica: <entryFree id="n20268" type="main" key="ha^ruspi^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăruspĭca</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ar-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>haruspex</etym>, <sense id="n20268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female haruspex</hi> or <hi rend="ital">soothsayer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 99</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20268.1" n="II" level="1"> = haruspicium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 203</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
haruspicalis: <entryFree id="n20269" type="main" key="ha^ruspi^ca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăruspĭcālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a soothsayer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 4, 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
haruspicinus: <entryFree id="n20270" type="main" key="ha^ruspi^ci_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăruspĭcīnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ar-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to the inspection of victims.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20270.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod Etruscorum declarant et haruspicini et fulgurales et tonitruales libri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:33:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 33, 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20270.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hăruspĭ-cīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. ars), <hi rend="ital">the art of divining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divination</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio, quae haruspicinae disciplina continetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:23:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 23, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 18, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
haruspicium: <entryFree id="n20271" type="main" key="ha^ruspi^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăruspĭcĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ar-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inspection of victims</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divination</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:90:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 90, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hasdrubal: <entryFree id="n20272" type="main" key="Hasdru^bal"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hasdrŭbal</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Asdr-</orth>), <itype>ălis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Punic name.</hi> The most celebrated are, </sense><sense id="n20272.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Mago</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the founder of the power of Carthage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 19, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20272.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Hanno</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who fought in Sicilia during the first Punic war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:54:section=125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 54, § 125</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20272.3" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The son-inlaw of Hamilcar Barcas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 1 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n20272.4" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The son of Hamilcar Barcas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brother of Hannibal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defeated</hi> B. C. 207 <hi rend="ital">at the Metaurus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:18 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 18 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:49" default="NO" valid="yes">49</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:770" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 770</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20272.5" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Gisco</hi>, <hi rend="ital">third Carthaginian general in Hispania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:12" default="NO" valid="yes">12</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n20272.6" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A general against Masinissa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:38:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 38, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi> 8 al.—</sense><sense id="n20272.7" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hasdrŭbălĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to one Hasdrubal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">funus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hasta: <entryFree id="n20273" type="main" key="hasta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hasta</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">asta</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. hastas, hand; cf. Gr. root <foreign lang="greek">xad</foreign>- in <foreign lang="greek">xanda/nw</foreign>, pre-hendo</etym>, <sense id="n20273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a spear</hi> (syn.: hastile, dolo, gaesum, sarisa, sparus, lancea, pilum, spiculum, telum, etc.). </sense><sense id="n20273.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20273.2" n="A" level="2"> Most freq. as a military weapon, <hi rend="ital">a lance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">javelin</hi> (cf. Becker's Antiq. III. 2, p. 242 sq.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec eminus hastis aut comminus gladiis uteretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: dum transit, striderat hasta, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 817</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 365 Vahl.): Hastati spargunt hastas, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 287 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">evelli jussit eam, qua erat transfixus, hastam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:30:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 30, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amentatus hastas torquebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 242</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:78:271" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 78, 271</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:17:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 17, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastas vibrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:80:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 80, 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 78, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dirigere in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contendere,</quote> <trans><tr>to hurl</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 521</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">protendere aut colligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:21 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 21 al.</bibl></cit>—As a symbol of war, sent in making a declaration of the same, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:27:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 27, 3</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=101" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 101</bibl> Müll., and thrown into the enemy's territory, Liv 1, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 9, 53</bibl>: pura, i. e. <hi rend="ital">without iron</hi>, given to brave soldiers as a mark of distinction, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 28, 29, § 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3457</bibl>; cf. Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 6, 760</bibl>, and Fest. l. l.— As the symbol of legal ownership: festuca uti quasi hastae loco, signo quodam justi dominii, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20273.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, beyond the milit. sphere: <cit><quote lang="la">jacet, diffidit, abjecit hastas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>has lost his courage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:21:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 21, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20273.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A spear stuck in the ground at public auctions or where the tribunals of the cenlumviri were held</hi> (orig. as a sign of booty gained in battle or of magisterial authority): <cit><quote lang="la">est enim ausus (Sulla) dicere, hasta posita, cum bona in foro venderet et bonorum virorum et locupletium et certe civium praedam se suam vendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 8, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hastam in foro ponere et bona civium voci subicere praeconis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 23, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta posita pro aede Jovis Statoris, bona voci acerbissimae subjecta praeconis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:26:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 26, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos non illa inflnita hasta satiavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emptio ab hasta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitibus eorum sub hasta venditis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:38:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 38, 7</bibl></cit>: municipia Italiae splendidissima sub hasta venierunt,<pb n="842" /> <cb n="HAUD" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:27" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">just hastae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum censores se jam locationibus abstinerent, convenere ad eos, qui hastae hujus generis assueverant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 18, 10</bibl></cit>; as a <hi rend="ital">badge of dignity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc miratur adhuc centum gravis hasta virorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:63:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 63, 7</bibl></cit>.—Hence, transf., <hi rend="ital">the centumviral court</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut centumviralem hastam, quam quaestura functi consuerant cogere, decemviri cogerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n20273.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A little spear</hi> with which a bride's hair was parted into locks, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:560" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 560</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20273.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A spear</hi>, as a gymnastic weapon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 73</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20273.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20273.8" n="A" level="2"> Of the form of a comet: jubae effigies mutata in hasta est. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 22, § 90</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n20273.9" n="B" level="2"> I. q. membrum virile, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 45, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hastarium: <entryFree id="n20274" type="main" key="hasta_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hastārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>hasta, I. B.</etym>, <sense id="n20274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an auction-catalogue</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Ap. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Nat. 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hastarius: <entryFree id="n20275" type="gloss" key="hasta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hastārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the spear</hi>: censio, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:54:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> 54, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20275.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to auctions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">auction-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">PRAETOR,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 379, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hastatus: <entryFree id="n20276" type="main" key="hasta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hastātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hasta, I. A.</etym>, <sense id="n20276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">armed with a spear.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20276.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Bellona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:718" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 718</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima utcumque acies hastata: ceteris praeusta aut brevia tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currum decem milia hastatorum sequebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15:7" default="NO">4, 15, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20276.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., milit. t. t.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hastāti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the first line of a Roman army drawn up in order of battle</hi> (behind them were the Principes and Triarii): <cit><quote lang="la">hastati dicti qui primi hastis pugnabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=89" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 89</bibl></cit> Müll.: hastati spargunt hastas, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 287 Vahl.); so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 20 al.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Dict. of Antiq.—The hastati were divided into ten ordines (companies),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:128" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 128</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n20276.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: primus, secundus, etc., ordo hastatus, and more freq. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: primus, secundus, etc., hastatus, <hi rend="ital">the first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">second</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">company of</hi> hastati: in eo exercitu miles gregarius fui: tertio anno virtutis causa, mihi T. Quintius decimum ordinem hastatum assignavit, i. e. <hi rend="ital">made me captain of the tenth</hi> (last) <hi rend="ital">company</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 34, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum signifer primi hastati signum non posset movere loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:35:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 35, 77</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 31, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">signifer secundi hastati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Hence, transf., </sense><sense id="n20276.4" n="2" level="3"> (Ellipt. for centurio ordinis hastati primus, secundus, etc., hastatus.) <hi rend="ital">The captain of the first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">second</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">company</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 8</bibl>: Q. Fulginius ex primo hastato, <hi rend="ital">late first centurio</hi> (i. e. who had been discharged as first centurio, and then served as evocatus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:46:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 46, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n20276.5" n="b" level="4"> <foreign lang="greek">*kat) e)coxh/n</foreign>, <itype>hastatus, i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the captain of the first company</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:18" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3455</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hastile: <entryFree id="n20277" type="main" key="hasti_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hastīle</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">astīle</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>hasta</etym>, <sense id="n20277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the shaft of a spear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">javelin.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20277.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum, quod ex hastili in corpore remanserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastili nixus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">missile telum hastili abiegno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 8, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20277.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20277.3" n="A" level="2"> (Pars pro toto.) <hi rend="ital">A spear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">javelin</hi>, in gen. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">torquere hastilia lenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 313</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 557</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 489</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 397" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 397</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curvatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:127" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 127</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20277.4" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a piece of wood in the form of a shaft</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). So of <hi rend="ital">branches</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 23</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">poles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">props</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 358</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:12:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 212</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the standard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">candelabri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:25:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 25, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 8, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hastula: <entryFree id="n20278" type="main" key="hastu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hastŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n20278.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little spear</hi>, Fronto de Or. 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n20278.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20278.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A little branch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:31:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 31, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20278.3" n="B" level="2"> Hastula regia, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> asphodelus, <hi rend="ital">asphodel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 17, 68, § 109</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
haterianus: <entryFree id="n20279" type="main" key="Hate^ri^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hatĕrĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n20279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Haterius</hi> (a jurist), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 18, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hau: <entryFree id="n20280" type="main" key="hau1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hau</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">au</orth>), <pos>interj.</pos>, an exclamation of pain or grief, <sense id="n20280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Oh! ah!</hi> au, nullan tibi lingua'st? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 5, 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 27</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n20281" type="main" key="hau2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hau</orth> = haud, v. haud <sense id="n20281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
haud: <entryFree id="n20282" type="main" key="haud"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haud</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">haut</orth> (in the form <orth extent="full" lang="la">hau</orth>, <itype>before consonants</itype>, several times in Plautus acc. to the Cod. Ambros., and in <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4848</bibl>: HEIC. EST. SEPVLCRVM. HAV. PVLCRVM. PVLCRAI. FEMINAE; also Tac. A. <cb n="HAUD" /> 2, 36; 6, 43 (49), Nipperdey, Ritter; hence, also hauscio = haud scio; cf. Ritschl, prol. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:page=99 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. p. 99 sq.</bibl> and p. 325), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>perh. orig. hau = <foreign lang="greek">ou)</foreign>, v. Ritschl l. l. But cf. Hand, Turs. III. 15.—Acc. to Corss. Ausspr. 1, 205, haud = pronom. stem ho + au (Sanscr. ava, away) + de, as in unde, etc.</etym>, a subjective and intensive negative particle, <sense id="n20282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not at all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by no means;</hi> in class. prose most freq. with adverbs; rarely with adjectives, pronouns, or verbs (the last construction in Cic. only in the formulae: haud scio an, and haud dubito; in Caes. it occurs but once; v. also Krebs, Antibarb. p. 516). </sense><sense id="n20282.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hau longe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hau longe abesse oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haut sane diu est,</quote> <trans><tr>it is but a very little while ago</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud sane commodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud sane intellego, quidnam sit, quod laudandum putat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: rem haud sane difficilem admirari videmini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud sane facile,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 23, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facio quod manifesto moechi haud ferme solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: haud ferme <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud ita jussi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud ita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eia, haud sic decet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 9, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haut aliter esse duco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliter hau dicetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud aliter censeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: ac veluti lupus ... Haud aliter Rutulo, muros et castra tuenti, Ignescunt irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 65</bibl></cit>; v. aliter; <cit><quote lang="la">and cf. also secus: nam ego hau diu apud hunc servitutem servio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 17</bibl></cit> Ritschl, <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud diu est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 67</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scies hau multo post,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud paulo plus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud minus aegre patior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud minus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:60:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 60, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Getae praetorii praefecto haud satis fidebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed haud facile dixerim, cur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">haud facile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 17, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 13, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum animi molles et aetate fluxi dolis haud difficulter capiebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud cito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 89</bibl></cit>: haud temere est, quod tu tristi cum corde gubernas, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 9, 329</bibl> (Ann. v. 473 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">haud temere est visum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 375</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiaris accipiere faxo hau familiariter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud stulte sapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud commode,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul haud dubie jam victor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 102:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 102, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vergilius haud dubie proximus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:85" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dubie: mihi hau saepe eveniunt tales hereditates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus haud saepe quemquam superat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud cunctanter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 6</bibl></cit>. For the connection with dum and quamquam, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n20282.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id esse hau perlonginquom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aetate hau bonum'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 61</bibl></cit>: haut doctis dictis certantes, sed male dictis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 10</bibl> (Ann. v. 274 Vahl.): ille vir haut magna cum re, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 1, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 342 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">hau mala'st mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conveni hodie hominem haud impurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anus haud impura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servum haud illiberalem praebes te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud mediocris vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haut consimili ingenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compendium haut aetati optabile,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hau permultum attulit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud mirabile est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene dicere haut absurdum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium ejus haut absurdum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 25, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud ignotae belli artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus haud dubiis consulibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. dubius and dubium: certe extrema linea Amare haud nihil est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20282.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">pronn.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haut quisquam quaeret, qui siem,</quote> <trans><tr>no one certainly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum salutat magis haut quiquam quam canem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 25</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">faxo haut quicquam sit morae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 3, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic se ipsus fallit, haud ego,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haud pol me quidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20282.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">verbs: Ni.</hi> Etiam dimidium censes (eum attulisse)? <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Non edepol scio: <cit><quote lang="la">Verum haut opinor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hauscio, quid eo opus sit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hau nosco tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ego cum illo pignus haut ausim dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod dixi semel, hau mutabo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 85</bibl></cit>; cf.: haud muto <cb n="HAUR" /> factum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hau moror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: philosophari est mihi necesse; nam omnino haut placet, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 1, 1</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 38, 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Trag. v. 417 Vahl.): pol me hau paenitet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facit ille, quod vulgo hau solent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego faxo hau dicet nactam, quem deluserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 8, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nae ille haud scit, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum ille haud dubitavit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod somno supererit, haud deerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud erit, ut merito immortalis possit haberi,</quote> <trans><tr>it cannot be</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 715</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. sum: quem (Drusum) haud fratris interitu trucem quam remoto aemulo aequiorem sibi sperabat,</quote> <trans><tr>not so much ... as</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—For the phrase haud scio an (in Plautus hauscio an), see an; cf. also, haud scio, -ne: idque adeo haud scio, mirandumne sit, etc., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:54:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 54, 5</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Am.</hi> Exspectatusne advenio? <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Hau vidi magis exspectatum, <hi rend="ital">I never saw any one welcomer</hi>, ironically, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 47</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hau vidi magis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 13</bibl>.—Pleonastic with another negative: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ego haut committam, ut, si peccatum siet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ille haud obiciet mihi, Pedibus sese provocatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post si quis vellet te, haut nevelles dividi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—Ellipt.: <hi rend="ital">Al.</hi> Quid istuc est, mi vir, negoti, quod tu tam subito domo Abeas? <hi rend="ital">Ju.</hi> Edepol haut quod tui me neque domi distaedeat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 5</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n20282.5" n="II" level="1"> Esp., joined with dum and quaquam. </sense><sense id="n20282.6" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">haud dum</orth>, <itype>or, as one word</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">haud-dum</orth>, <itype>an intensive nondum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">not at all as yet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not yet</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">concilione ... Pro Superi! Ausonius miles sedet? armaque tantum Hauddum sumpta viro?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:332" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 332</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25" default="NO" valid="yes">25</bibl>; 22, 12; 28, 2; 33, 11 al.—</sense><sense id="n20282.7" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">haud quāquam</orth>, <itype>or, as one word</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">haudquāquam</orth>, <hi rend="ital">by no means whatever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not at all</hi> (class.): haudquaquam quemquam semper Fortuna secuta est, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 299 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">haudquaquam etiam cessant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haudquaquam id est difficile Crasso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:33:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 33, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haudquaquam hercle mirandum est esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 22, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haudquaquam boni est, ratione vinctum velle dissolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo prudens et gravis, haudquaquam eloquens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accedat huc suavitas quaedam oportet sermonum atque morum haudquaquam mediocre condimentum amicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:18:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 18, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haudquaquam par gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haudquaquam certamine ambiguo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 26, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi has, miserabilis Orpheus Haudquaquam ob meritum, poenas, ni Fata resistant, Suscitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:455" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 455</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haudquaquam dictis violentia Turni flectitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:45 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 45 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
hauddum: <entryFree id="n20283" type="main" key="hauddum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hauddum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">haudquāquam</orth>, v. haud, II. A. and B.</entryFree>
haurio: <entryFree id="n20284" type="main" key="hauri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haurĭo</orth>, <itype>hausi, haustum, 4</itype> (archaic <sense id="n20284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi> hauribant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1324</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> haurierint, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 905</bibl> P.; <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> haurītus, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 139</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6</bibl>, p. 178; <hi rend="ital">supin.</hi> hauritu, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl>, p. 121; <hi rend="ital">part. fut.</hi> hauritura, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:in Joh. 2:253" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> in Joh. 2, 253</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hausurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 383</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:584" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 584</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:11" default="NO">16, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hausturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:2:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">dep. perf.</hi> foramen fama est lucem hausum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 5, 15</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>perh. for haus-io; cf. hio, hisco; prop. to empty</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to draw up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to draw</hi> (class., esp. freq. in the transf. and trop. signif.; cf. sorbeo). </sense><sense id="n20284.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to draw</hi> water, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vidisset haustam aquam de jugi puteo, terrae motum dixit instare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:50:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 50, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmis hausta duabus aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:294" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 294</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is neque limo Turbatam haurit aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse manus hausta victrices abluit unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:740" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 740</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">num igitur, si potare velit, de dolio sibi hauriendum putet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:288" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 83, 288</bibl></cit>. —Prov.: de faece haurire, <hi rend="ital">to draw from the dregs</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to choose the worst</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu quidem de faece hauris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>speak of the worst orators</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 69, 244</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20284.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20284.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To drain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drink up; to spill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita vina ex libidine hauriuntur, atque etiam praemio invitatur ebrietas (shortly before and after, bibere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 140</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 146; and: cui non audita est obscoenae Salmacis undae Aethiopesque lacus, quos si quis faucibus hausit, Aut furit <pb n="843" /> <cb n="HAUR" /> aut, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 320</bibl> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ex Clitorio lacu biberint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 13, § 16</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">quae (pocula) simul arenti sitientes hausimus ore,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>drained</tr>, <tr>emptied</tr>, <tr>drunk off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 277</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cratera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:680" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 680</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spumantem pateram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:738" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 738</bibl></cit>: statim me perculso ad meum sanguinem hauriendum, et spirante re publica ad ejus spolia detrahenda advolaverunt, <hi rend="ital">to drain</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to spill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:24:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 24, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 333</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 331</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudantis cervicem jugulumque, et reliquum sanguinem jubentes haurire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:51:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 51, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (sanguinem) civiles hauserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20284.4" n="b" level="4"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">imoque a gurgite pontus Vertitur et canas alveus haurit aquas,</quote> <trans><tr>draws in</tr>, <tr>lets in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:591" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 591</bibl></cit>: jam flammae tulerint, inimicus et hauserit ensis, <hi rend="ital">drunk up</hi>, i. e. their blood, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:600" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 600</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20284.5" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to tear up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pluck out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take to one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take; to swallow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhaust</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ventus) Arbusta evolvens radicibus haurit ab imis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haurit arenas ungula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:46" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 46</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">humumque Effodit ... terraeque immurmurat haustae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>torn up</tr>, <tr>dug up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Actoridae magni rostro femur hausit adunco (= transfodit),</quote> <trans><tr>tore open</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:370" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 370</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:438" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 438</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1324</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 126</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 412</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 314</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 387</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventrem atque inguina uno alteroque ictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:524" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 524</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum latus ejus gladio haurit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:2:27" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impresso gladio jugulum ejus hausisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen,</quote> <trans><tr>to pluck out the eye</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:564" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 564</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cineres haustos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>scraped up</tr>, <tr>collected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:538" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 538</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cineres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:425" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 425</bibl></cit> sq.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:136" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 136</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille cavis hausto spargit me pulvere palmis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptum haurit ex aerario,</quote> <trans><tr>draws</tr>, <tr>takes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 13, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">at suave est ex magno tollere acervo. Dum ex parvo nobis tantundem haurire relinquas, Cur? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia dentibus carent, aut lambunt cibos aut integros hauriunt,</quote> <trans><tr>to swallow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">solidos haurire cervos taurosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 14, 14, § 36</bibl></cit>: hausisti patrias luxuriosus opes, qs. <hi rend="ital">hast swallowed up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devoured</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consumed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:83:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 83, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos tellus haurit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:654" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 654</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sua haurire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam recipere auramque communem haurire,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>inhale</tr>, <tr>breathe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">12: suspiratus,</quote> <trans><tr>fetching a deep sigh</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 129</bibl></cit>: hauriat hunc oculis ignem crudelis ab alto Dardanus, <hi rend="ital">may he swallow with his eyes</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">greedily look at</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 661</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid oculis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 946</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:284" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 284</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and without oculis: caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:899" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 899</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lucem (primae pecudes),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to see the light</tr>, <tr>be born</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 340</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocemque his auribus hausi,</quote> <trans><tr>I received his voice with these ears</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 359</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dicta auribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:787" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 787</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis auribusque tantum gaudium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hauriri urbes terrae hiatibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to be swallowed up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 119</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum praealtis paludibus arma, equi haurirentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altitudine et mollitia nivis hauriebantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hauriuntur gurgitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aggerem ac vineas incendium hausit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctos incendium hausit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miratur et haurit Pectore ignes,</quote> <trans><tr>imbibes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 253</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">flammasque latentes Hausit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:325" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelo medium Sol igneus orbem Hauserat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>had rapidly passed through</tr>, <tr>finished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 427</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vastum iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:369" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 369</bibl></cit>: bracchia Cancri (Titan), Col. poët. 10, 313: cum spes arrectae juvenum exsultantiaque haurit Corda pavor pulsans, <hi rend="ital">exhausts</hi> = exhaurit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 105</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pariter pallorque ruborque Purpureas hausere genas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:538" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 538</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20284.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to draw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">borrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drink in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">derive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequimur potissimum Stoicos, non ut interpretes, sed, ut solemus, e fontibus eorum judicio arbitrioque nostro, quantum quoque modo videbitur, hauriemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes, unde hauriretis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:46:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 46, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a fontibus potius haurire quam rivulos consectari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reconditis atque abditis e fontibus haurire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia dixi hausta e fonte naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:21:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 21, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem fonte haurire laudes suas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 6, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:27:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 27, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (legem) non didicimus, accepimus, legimus, verum ex natura ipsa arripuimus, hausimus, expressimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 10</bibl></cit> <cb n="HEBD" /> (quoted in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:49:165" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 49, 165</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">quas (artes) cum domo haurire non posses, arcessivisti ex urbe ea (i. e. Athenis), quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:97:332" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 97, 332</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex divinitate, unde omnes animos haustos aut acceptos aut libatos haberemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:11:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 11, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">animos hominum quadam ex parte extrinsecus esse tractos et haustos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 32, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim non sorbere animo, quid non haurire cogitatione, cujus sanguinem non bibere censetis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatem sitiens hausit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptates undique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:6:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:24:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 24, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:35:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 35, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:29:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 29, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde laboris Plus haurire mali est quam ex re decerpere fructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo spem turbidus hausit inanem,</quote> <trans><tr>drank in illusive hope</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:648" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 648</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expugnationes urbium, populationes agrorum, raptus Penatium hauserant animo,</quote> <trans><tr>had thought of</tr>, <tr>intended</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicia,</quote> <trans><tr>to suffer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Thessali) velut ex diutina siti nimis avide meram haurientes libertatem,</quote> <trans><tr>indulging</tr>, <tr>revelling in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 26, 7</bibl></cit>;
