cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">studium philosophiae acriter hausisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hauritorium: <entryFree id="n20285" type="gloss" key="hauri_to_ri^u^m"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haurītōrĭŭm</orth>, ii. <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)ntlhth/rion</foreign> (<sense id="n20285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bucket</hi>), Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
hauritus: <entryFree id="n20286" type="main" key="hauri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haurītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. haurio <sense id="n20286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
haustor: <entryFree id="n20287" type="main" key="haustor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haustor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">aus-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>haurio</etym>, <sense id="n20287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drawer</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): aquarum, <hi rend="ital">water-drawer</hi>, Firm. Math. 8, 29.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultimus aquae,</quote> <trans><tr>drinker</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 591</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">he who fills casks with wine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 5089</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
haustrum: <entryFree id="n20288" type="hapax" key="haustrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haustrum</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">austrum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a machine for drawing water</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:516" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 516</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 13, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
haustus: <entryFree id="n20289" type="main" key="haustus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from haurio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n20290" type="main" key="haustus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haustus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>haurio</etym>, <sense id="n20290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drawing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20290.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua, quae non sit haustus profundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puteus in tenues plantas facili diffunditur haustu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:227" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 227</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 4</bibl>: aquae ductus, haustus, iter, actus, etc.... a jure civili sumitur, <hi rend="ital">the right of drawing</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:26:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 26, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haustus ex fonte privato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:3:section=3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 8, 3, 3, § 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n20290.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a drinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swallowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drawing in;</hi> and concr., <hi rend="ital">a drink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draught</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; for the most part only in the <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">largos haustus e fontibu' magnis Lingua fundet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 412</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe, sed exiguis haustibus inde (i. e. rivo) bibi,</quote> <trans><tr>in small draughts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:274" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haustu sparsus aquarum Ora fove,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haustus aquae mihi nectar erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 345</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchi (i. e. vini) haustus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:450" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 450</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the stream</tr>, <tr>current</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catulus se ignis haustu ludibrio hostium exemit,</quote> <trans><tr>swallowing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:15" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse apibus partem divinae mentis et haustus Aetherios,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>breath</tr>, <tr>soul</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 220</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alium domi esse caeli haustum, alium lucis aspectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(canes) Suspensis teneros imitantur dentibus haustus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>gentle snappings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1068" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1068</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrinae haustus arenae,</quote> <trans><tr>a handful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 526</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">angusti puero date pulveris haustus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:427" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 427</bibl></cit>; v. haurio.—</sense><sense id="n20290.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pindarici fontis qui non expalluit haustus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to drink from</tr>, <tr>to imitate</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitiae haustus bibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
haut: <entryFree id="n20291" type="main" key="haut"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haut</orth>, v. haud.</entryFree>
have: <entryFree id="n20292" type="main" key="have"><orth extent="full" lang="la">have</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">haveo</orth>, v. 2. aveo.</entryFree>
heautontimorumenos: <entryFree id="n20293" type="greek" key="He^autonti_mo_ru_me^nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕautontīmōrūmĕnos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(eauto\n timwrou/menos</foreign>, <sense id="n20293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">The Self-tormentor</hi>, the title of a comedy of Terence, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 5</bibl> (= Ipse se puniens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:27:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 27, 65</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
hebdomada: <entryFree id="n20294" type="main" key="hebdo^ma^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hebdŏmăda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>hebdomas</etym>, <sense id="n20294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the number seven</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">annorum, librorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:10:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 10, 17</bibl></cit>.—Esp., = hebdomas, <hi rend="ital">seven days</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:10:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 10, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> de Nat. R. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:29:27 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 29, 27 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:34:22 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Exod. 34, 22 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
hebdomadalis: <entryFree id="n20295" type="main" key="hebdo^ma^da_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hebdŏmădālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a week</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weekly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">festa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
hebdomas: <entryFree id="n20296" type="main" key="hebdo^mas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hebdŏmas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(bdoma/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the number seven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seven days</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri, qui inscribuntur Hebdomades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:10:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septima fere hebdomade, id est, nono et quadragesimo die, Varr. ib. § 7: hebdomadibus lunae,</quote> <trans><tr>on every seventh day of the moon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:2:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of the critical seventh day in diseases: symphoniam Lysonis vellem vitasses,<cb n="HEBE" />  ne in quartam hebdomada incideres, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 9, 3</bibl> (cf. collat. form hebdomada, s. v.).</sense></entryFree>
hebdomaticus: <entryFree id="n20297" type="greek" key="hebdo^ma^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hebdŏmătĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-mădĭcus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(bdomatiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to the number seven</hi>: septeni et noveni anni, qui hebdomatici a Graecis atque enneatici appellantur, i. e. <hi rend="ital">critical</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decisive of one's fate</hi>, Firm. Math. 4, 14 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
hebe: <entryFree id="n20298" type="main" key="He_be_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēbē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> =<foreign lang="greek">*(/hbh</foreign> (youth), <sense id="n20298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of youth</hi> (pure Lat. Juventas), <hi rend="ital">the daughter of Juno</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cup-bearer to the gods</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after the deification of Hercules</hi>, <hi rend="ital">his wife</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 400</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:13:23" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 13, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 116</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 134 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
hebeninus: <entryFree id="n20299" type="main" key="he^be^ni^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕbĕnĭnus</orth>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕbĕnĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <foreign lang="greek">e)be/ninos</foreign>, <sense id="n20299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of ebony</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ezech. 27, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
hebenus: <entryFree id="n20300" type="main" key="he^be^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕbĕnus</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕbĕnus</orth>, R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Prol. Verg. p. 421</bibl>), i. <gen>f.</gen>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e/(benos, e/)benos</foreign>, <sense id="n20300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the ebon-tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ebony</hi>: Diospyros ebenum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 76, § 204</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:197" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 30, 35, § 197</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:610" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 610</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:135" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 135</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 7, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hebeo: <entryFree id="n20301" type="main" key="he^be^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕbĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n20301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be blunt</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dull</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n20301.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum nunc hebet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:45:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 45, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20301.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sluggish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inactive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not lively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelidus tardante senecta Sanguis hebet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 396</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus hebet somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:41" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stella hebet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:371" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 371</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et jam Plias hebet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:722" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 722</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi hebent mira diversitate naturae, cum iidem homines sic ament inertiam et oderint quietem,</quote> <trans><tr>lounge about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid stolidi ad speciem notae novitatis hebetis?</quote> <trans><tr>are amazed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporis adversi sic mihi sensus hebet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:48" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olim annis ille ardor hebet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:53" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hebent irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:386" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 386</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hebes: <entryFree id="n20302" type="main" key="he^bes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕbes</orth>, <itype>ĕtis</itype> (<sense id="n20302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acc. sing.</hi> hebem, Enn. and Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 107</bibl> P.; <case>abl.</case> hebeti; <cit><quote lang="la">but hebete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hebeo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">blunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dull</hi>, in opp. to pointed or sharp (class.; esp. freq. in the trop. sense). </sense><sense id="n20302.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: cujus (lunae) et nascentis et insenescentis alias hebetiora alias acutiora videntur cornua, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 122, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela leviora atque hebetiora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo latiora (ossa) quaque parte sunt, hoc hebetiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponite jam gladios hebetes, pugnetur acutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:589" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 589</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">machaera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 53</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hebeti mucrone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1274</bibl></cit>, and hebeti ictu, <hi rend="ital">which does not penetrate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oryx hebeti ferro caeditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:140" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:137" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angulus,</quote> <trans><tr>obtuse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:de Form. Agr. p. 32" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> de Form. Agr. p. 32</bibl></cit> Goes.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕbĕtĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">blunt tools</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 12, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20302.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of sight, hearing, smell, taste, <hi rend="ital">dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faint</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utroque oculo natura hebete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:15:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:365" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 365</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(orbem solis) adhuc hebetem vicina nocte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:2:289" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 2, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carbunculi hebetiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 26, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postea quam sensi populi Romani aures hebetiores, oculos autem esse acres atque acutos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:27:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 27, 66</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva gustu hebes,</quote> <trans><tr>tasteless</tr>, <tr>insipid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:24" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: genus croci, <hi rend="ital">without smell</hi> (opp. odoratum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 39, § 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">os hebes est, positaeque movent fastidia mensae,</quote> <trans><tr>without appetite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:10:7" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro,</quote> <trans><tr>without feeling</tr>, <tr>dead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 6, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 13, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa gingivarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:15:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 15, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui torpet hebes locus ille,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:799" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 799</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n20302.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sluggish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heavy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doltish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupid</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">bardus, stupidus, ineptus, absurdus, stultus, fatuus, stolidus, brutus, etc.): sensus omnes hebetes et tardos esse arbitrabantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 8, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer incessu tardus, sensu hebes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 17, § 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta solertia animalium hebetissimis quoque est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:30:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 30, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epicurus, quem hebetem et rudem dicere solent Stoici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:50:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 50, 103</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium ceterarum rerum oratio ludus est homini non hebeti neque inexercitato neque communium litterarum et politioris humanitatis experti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:17:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 17, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 87, 357</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me hebetem molestiae reddiderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi qui sit plane hebes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi forte tam hebes futurus est judex, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: hebes ad aliquid, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 13, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quis adeo hebes inveniretur, ut crederet? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 11</bibl></cit>: exercitus hebes infirmusque, <hi rend="ital">raw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undisciplined</hi>,=rudis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 54:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 54, 3</bibl>: hebes ad sustinendum laborem <pb n="844" /> <cb n="HEBR" /> miles, <hi rend="ital">sluggish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tardy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 135</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentia bruta et hebes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:37:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 37, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spondeus quod est e longis duabus, hebetior videtur et tardior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:64:216" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 64, 216</bibl></cit>: sed hac rhetorica philosophorum, non nostra illa forensi, quam necesse est, cum populariter loquatur, esse interdum paulo hebetiorem, i. e. <hi rend="ital">more superficial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi> (opp. to philosophical acuteness, nicety), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:6:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 6, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc Pansa aut non videt (hebeti enim ingenio est) aut negligit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 8, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hebetiora hominum ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:6:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 46, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam hebes, sordida, jejuna oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasdam (litteras) velut acriores parum efficimus et aliis non dissimilibus sed quasi hebetioribus permutamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 4</bibl></cit>.—Of a speaker: hebes lingua, magis malus quam callidus ingenio, Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:de Rep. 2:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> de Rep. 2, 9, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hebesco: <entryFree id="n20303" type="main" key="he^besco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕbesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n20303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [hebeo], <hi rend="ital">to grow blunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dim</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">faint</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n20303.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">acumina (gladiorum) densis ictibus hebescebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 12, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hebescunt sensus, membra torpent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 50, 51, § 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hebescebant (oculi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">berylli hebescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 20, § 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hebescere sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hebescere dextras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:19" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20303.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic mentis acies se ipsam intuens nonnumquam hebescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 30, 73</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nos vicesimum jam diem patimur hebescere aciem horum auctoritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nosmetipsos hebescere et languere nolumus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illi per fastidium et contumaciam hebescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hebescere virtus, paupertas probro haberi coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 12, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hebetatio: <entryFree id="n20304" type="main" key="he^be^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕbĕtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>hebeto</etym>, <sense id="n20304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dimness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 6, 16, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nascitur ex assiduitate laborum animorum hebetatio quaedam ac languor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. An. 15:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. An. 15, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hebetatrix: <entryFree id="n20305" type="hapax" key="he^be^ta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕbĕtātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that makes dull</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dim</hi>: umbra, i. e. <hi rend="ital">darkening</hi> (shortly before: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra terrae lunam hebetari),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 13, 10, § 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hebetesco: <entryFree id="n20306" type="main" key="he^be^tesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕbĕtesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n20306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [hebes], <hi rend="ital">to grow dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dim</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">faint</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aciem in cultris tonsorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 7, 23, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies oculi hebetescit ac paene caligat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor hebetescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 56" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hebeto: <entryFree id="n20307" type="main" key="he^be^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕbĕto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make blunt</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to blunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deaden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weaken</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n20307.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulneribus suis ferrum hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 35, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:105" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 6, 21, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">visus alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:605" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 605</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies hebetarat sidera,</quote> <trans><tr>had dimmed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 444</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra terrae lunam hebetari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 13, 10, § 57</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">smaragdos in sole hebetari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 5, 18, § 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:79" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 7, 23, § 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auster aures hebetat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primores dentes mollientes aut hebetantes verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 15, § 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cummium genera amaritudines hebetant,</quote> <trans><tr>moderate</tr>, <tr>lessen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 11, 64, § 105</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">venena omnia (oleum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 4, 40, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor suavior e longinquo, propius admotus hebetatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 7, 18, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faba hebetare sensus existimata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 12, 30, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos mihi taurorum flammas hebetastis,</quote> <trans><tr>quenched the fiery breath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 210</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20307.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make stupid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo simul et corpore hebetato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lethe hebetans pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:1:17" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hebetatum ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 14, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae vires hebetatae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vino tristitia et cura hebetatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 22, § 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hebetudo: <entryFree id="n20308" type="main" key="he^be^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕbĕtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bluntness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dulness</hi> (post-class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">hebetatio): sensuum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superba istorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 7:21" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 7, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hebraei: <entryFree id="n20309" type="main" key="He^braei"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕbraei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ebrai=oi</foreign>, <sense id="n20309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Hebrews</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hebraei, qui nunc Judaei: igitur et litterae Hebraeae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">postea vero cum in deserto consedissent, amiserunt vetus nomen Hebraei, et Judaei sunt appellati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 13, 8</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n20309.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n20309.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕbræus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Hebrews</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hebrew</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquores,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>balsam</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:213" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 213</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 111</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">lingua, litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 18:39" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 18, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:42" default="NO">42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">codices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:ib. 43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20309.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hē^brā^ĭcus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <cb n="HECU" /> <itype>um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">plebes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Avit. 5, 544</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripturae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 7</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hē^-brā^ĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the Hebrew language</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Hebrew</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hebraice Messias dicitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 7, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hebria: <entryFree id="n20310" type="gloss" key="hebria"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hebria</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wine-vessel</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 63</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
hebrus: <entryFree id="n20311" type="main" key="He^brus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕbrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(/ebros</foreign>. <sense id="n20311.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The principal river in Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which rises in Mount Hœmus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and flows into the Ægean Sea</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Maritza</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:8" default="NO">8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 463</bibl>; and esp. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> v. 523</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 317</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:25:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 25, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:737" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 737</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 257</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 50</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">sacer, on account of the festivals of Bacchus celebrated on its banks,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 114</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20311.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Trojan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slain by Mezentius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:696" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 696</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20311.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a beautiful youth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 12, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hecaerge: <entryFree id="n20312" type="main" key="He^ca^erge_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕcăergē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>,=<foreign lang="greek">*(ekae/rgh</foreign>. <sense id="n20312.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of Diana</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 11, 532</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n20312.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the daughters of Boreas</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 3, 253</bibl> and 308.</sense></entryFree>
hecale: <entryFree id="n20313" type="main" key="He^ca^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕcălē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(eka/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n20313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poor old woman who kindly received Theseus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated by Callimachus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 44, § 88</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 747</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 135, 8, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hecataeus: <entryFree id="n20314" type="main" key="He^ca^taeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕcătaeus</orth>, i. <gen>m.</gen>, =<foreign lang="greek">*(ekatai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n20314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a famous historian and geographer of Miletus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Hegesander</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 20, § 55</bibl>; Solin. 19, 2; <cit><quote lang="la">40, 6: Milesius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Or. Mar. 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hecate: <entryFree id="n20315" type="main" key="He^ca^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕcătē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(eka/th</foreign>, <sense id="n20315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of Perses</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">Persœus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Asteria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sister of Latona</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the presider over enchantments</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conjurations</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">she is often identified with Diana</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Luna</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Proserpina</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and is therefore represented with three heads</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:18:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 18, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:511" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 511</bibl> Serv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">94</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">194</bibl>; 14, 405; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:141" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phaedr. 420" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phaedr. 420</bibl> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n20315.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n20315.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕcătēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Hecate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hecateian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>magical incantations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aulis,</quote> <trans><tr>devoted to Diana</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:447" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 447</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Idus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of August</tr>, <tr>sacred to Diana</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Silv. 3, 1, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20315.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕcătēïs</orth>, <itype>ĭdos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Hecateian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>enchanter's nightshade</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 139</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hecato: <entryFree id="n20316" type="main" key="He^ca^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕcăto</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(eka/twn</foreign>, <sense id="n20316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a philosopher of Rhodes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pupil of Panœtius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 15, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 23, 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hecatombe: <entryFree id="n20317" type="greek" key="he^ca^tombe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕcătombē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(kato/mbh</foreign>, <sense id="n20317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a great sacrifice of a hundred oxen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hecatomb</hi> (ante- and post-class.): facere hecatomben, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 131, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:101 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 101 al.</bibl>—In <number>plur.</number>: celebratis hecatombis, Treb. Gall. 9.—<hi rend="ital">Dim.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕcătombĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 205</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hecatompolis: <entryFree id="n20318" type="main" key="he^ca^tompo^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕcătompŏlis</orth>, <case>acc.</case> <itype>in</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(kato/mpolis</foreign>, <sense id="n20318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a hundred cities</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Creta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 14, 6, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hecatompylos: <entryFree id="n20319" type="greek" key="he^ca^tompy^los"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕcătompylos</orth>, <itype>on</itype> (-os, <gen>com.</gen>; -on, <sense id="n20319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neut.</hi>), <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(kato/mpulos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of a hundred gates</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hecatompylos Thebas nemo non novit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 275" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 275</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hecatontas: <entryFree id="n20320" type="greek" key="he^ca^tontas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕcătontas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(katonta/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the number one hundred</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 734, 746</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hector: <entryFree id="n20321" type="main" key="Hector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hector</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype> (Hectōris, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 17, 39</bibl> = Trag. v. 25 Vahl.; id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=70" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 70</bibl> Müll. = Trag. v. 130 Vahl.; <case>acc.</case> Hectorem, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 105</bibl> = Trag. v. 129 Vahl.; cf. Varr. L. L. l. l.), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(/ektwr</foreign>, <sense id="n20321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Priam and Hecuba</hi>, <hi rend="ital">husband of Andromache</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the bravest of the Trojans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slain and dragged three times around Troy by Achilles</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:483" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 483</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 270</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">282</bibl>; 522; 6, 166; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 9, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 7, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20321.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hectŏrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Hector;</hi> in <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf., <hi rend="ital">of the Trojans</hi>, and, as descended from the latter, <hi rend="ital">of the Romans; Hectorean; Trojan; Roman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjux,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Andromache</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 488</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta,</quote> <trans><tr>Hector's</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 67</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 543</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, tumulus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 304</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mars,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Hector in battle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 275</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Trojan</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnes, Xanthum et Simoënta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 634</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes et fiducia gentis Regulus Hectoreae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the Romans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:343" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 343</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hecuba: <entryFree id="n20322" type="main" key="He^cu^ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕcŭba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕcŭbē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(eka/bh</foreign>, <sense id="n20322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the daughter of Dymas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wife of Priam; after the destruction of Troy the</hi> <cb n="HELC" /> <hi rend="ital">slave of Penelope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">changed through rage into a dog</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:501" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 501</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">515</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 423</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">549</bibl> sq.; 577; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:26:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 26, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:15:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 15, 34</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an ugly old woman</hi> (opp. to Andromache), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:76:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 76, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hecyra: <entryFree id="n20323" type="greek" key="He^cy^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕcyra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ekura/</foreign>, <sense id="n20323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">The Stepmother</hi>, the title of a comedy of Terence.</sense></entryFree>
hedera: <entryFree id="n20324" type="main" key="he^de^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕdĕra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ĕdĕra</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ivy</hi>, Hedera helix, Linn.; sacred to Bacchus, and hence wound around the thyrsus; <cit><quote lang="la">also made into garlands with which poets were crowned,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 34, 62, § 144</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:767" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 767</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 338</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 7, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> ib. 7, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 258</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 25, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:29 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 29 al.</bibl> —In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:124 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 124 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
hederaceus: <entryFree id="n20325" type="main" key="he^de^ra_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕdĕrācĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ĕd-</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hedera</etym>, <sense id="n20325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of ivy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ivy-.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20325.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">materia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 24, 38, § 92</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20325.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">ivy-colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ivygreen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aurel. 49</bibl></cit>: patina argentea, Gallien. ap. Treb. Poll. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 17, 5</bibl> Peter.</sense></entryFree>
hederatus: <entryFree id="n20326" type="main" key="he^de^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕdĕrātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ĕd-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adorned</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crowned with ivy</hi>: patina argentea, Gall. ap. Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 17</bibl> dub. (Peter, hederaceam): <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pompae,</quote> <trans><tr>Bacchic</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 26, 278</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liber,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hederiger: <entryFree id="n20327" type="hapax" key="he^de^ri^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕdĕrĭger</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ĕd-</orth>), <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ivy-bearing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maenades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hederosus: <entryFree id="n20328" type="hapax" key="he^de^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕdĕrōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ĕd-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of ivy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">antrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 3.</sense></entryFree>
hedone: <entryFree id="n20329" type="greek" key="He_do^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēdŏnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(hdonh/</foreign> (delight), <sense id="n20329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the œons of Valentinian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hedui: <entryFree id="n20330" type="main" key="He_dui"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēdui</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Aedui.</entryFree>
heduphagetica: <entryFree id="n20331" type="greek" key="He_du^pha^ge_ti^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēdŭphăgētĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(hdufaghtika/</foreign> (i. e. belonging to sweet eating), <sense id="n20331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the title of a poem of Ennius;</hi> cf. Vahl. Ennius, p. xci. and 166 sq.</sense></entryFree>
hedychrum: <entryFree id="n20332" type="greek" key="he_dy_^chrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēdȳ^chrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(du/xroun</foreign>, <sense id="n20332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sweet-smelling ointment used for beautifying the skin; a cosmetic balsam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">psaltriam adducamus, hedychri incendamus scutellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hedymeles: <entryFree id="n20333" type="main" key="He_dy^me^les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēdymĕles</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">h(du/</foreign> + <foreign lang="greek">me/los</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n20333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a musician</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:383" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 383</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hedyosmos: <entryFree id="n20334" type="greek" key="he_dy^osmos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēdyosmos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(du/osmos</foreign>, <sense id="n20334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the herb wild mint</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 51, § 181</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hedypnois: <entryFree id="n20335" type="greek" key="he_dypno^is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēdypnŏis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(dupnoi+/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of succory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 8, 31, § 75</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hedysma: <entryFree id="n20336" type="greek" key="he_dysma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēdysma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(/dusma</foreign> (perfume), <sense id="n20336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sweet-smelling ingredient in ointments</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a perfume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">balsam</hi> (opp. stymma), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hegesaretos: <entryFree id="n20337" type="main" key="He_ge_sa_re_tos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēgēsārētos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Thessalian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hegesias: <entryFree id="n20338" type="main" key="He_ge_si^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēgēsĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n20338.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Cyrenaic philosopher</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:34:83 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 34, 83 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:9:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 9, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20338.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A rhetorician and historian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:286" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 83, 286</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:67:226 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 67, 226 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
hegesinus: <entryFree id="n20339" type="main" key="He_ge_si_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēgēsīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Academic philosopher</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hehae: <entryFree id="n20340" type="main" key="he^hae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕhae</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>; an exclamation, <sense id="n20340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he! he!</hi> Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=93" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 93</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 207 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
hei: <entryFree id="n20341" type="main" key="hei"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hei</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">ei</orth>), <pos>interj.</pos>, an exclamation of grief or fear, <sense id="n20341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ah! woe!</hi> freq. joined with mihi, <hi rend="ital">ah me! woe is me!</hi> hei, perii miser! <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hei, occidi!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hei, non placet convivium!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Amph. 2, 2, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hei, vereor, ne quid Andria apportet mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hei, metuo lenonem ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hei, video uxorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 3, 14</bibl></cit> ei mihi, qualis erat! Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 2, 274</bibl>; imitated by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 274</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hei mihi, perii hercle!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Am.</hi> Hei mihi! <hi rend="ital">Br.</hi> Ne pave, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Amph. 5, 1, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hei mihi, vereor dicere!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hei mihi, quantum Praesidium Ausonia et quantum tu perdis, Iule!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hei mihi! conclamat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hei mihi! hei mihi! istaec illum perdidit assentatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hei misero mihi!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 2, 5</bibl>. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
heia: <entryFree id="n20342" type="main" key="heia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">heia</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, v. eia.</entryFree>
heic: <entryFree id="n20343" type="main" key="heic"><orth extent="full" lang="la">heic</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. hic, III. 2 <sense id="n20343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
heius: <entryFree id="n20344" type="main" key="He_ius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēïus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<foreign lang="greek">*(/hi+os</foreign>), <sense id="n20344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:18:47 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 18, 47 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
helciarius: <entryFree id="n20345" type="main" key="helci^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">helcĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>helcium</etym>, <sense id="n20345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who draws small vessels up the stream</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:64:22" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 64, 22</bibl>; Sid. poët. Ep. 2, 10.</sense></entryFree>
helcium: <entryFree id="n20346" type="greek" key="helcium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">helcium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(/lkion</foreign>, <sense id="n20346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that with</hi> <pb n="845" /> <cb n="HELI" /> <hi rend="ital">which a load is drawn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a yoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horse-collar</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 222</bibl> and 227.</sense></entryFree>
helcysma: <entryFree id="n20347" type="greek" key="helcysma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">helcysma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(/lkusma</foreign>, <sense id="n20347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the dross of molten silver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silver-dross</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 35, § 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
helena: <entryFree id="n20348" type="main" key="He^le^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕlĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕlĕnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ele/nh</foreign>. <sense id="n20348.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of Jupiler and Leda</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sister of Castor and Pollux and of Clytemnestra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and wife of Menelaüs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on account of her beauty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was carried off by Paris to Troy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and thus became the cause of the Trojan war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:22:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 22, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 364</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 200</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 669</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 8</bibl> (4, 7), 32; 3, 14 (4, 13), 19; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 9, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 81" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 81</bibl> and 118: <cit><quote lang="la">Penelope venit, abit Helene,</quote> <trans><tr>a Helen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:62:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 62, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20348.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in naut. lang., <hi rend="ital">a single star appearing to mariners</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which was regarded as an unfavorable prognostic; while a double light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which was conceived to be favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was called Castor and Pollux</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 37, 37, § 101</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:792" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 792</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 3, 2, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20348.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The surname of the mother of the emperor Constantine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 41" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 284, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
helenium: <entryFree id="n20349" type="greek" key="he^le^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕlĕnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(le/nion</foreign>, <sense id="n20349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the elecampane</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 10, 33, § 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:159" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 21, 91, § 159</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
helenius: <entryFree id="n20350" type="main" key="He^le^nius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕlĕnius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Latin proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 12, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
helenus: <entryFree id="n20351" type="main" key="He^le^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕlĕnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(/elenos</foreign>, <sense id="n20351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Priam and Hecuba</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a celebrated soothsayer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:40:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 40, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 295</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">329</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 17, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
heleoselinon: <entryFree id="n20352" type="greek" key="he^le_o^se^li_non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕlēŏsĕlīnon</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕlīŏsĕlīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(leiose/linon</foreign>, <sense id="n20352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">smallage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celery</hi>, Apium graveolens, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 37, § 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:117" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 11, 46, § 117</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Apr. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
helepolis: <entryFree id="n20353" type="greek" key="he^le^po^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕlĕpŏlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(le/polis</foreign> (citytaking), <sense id="n20353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a besieging engine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invented by Demetrius Poliorcetes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
helernus: <entryFree id="n20354" type="main" key="He^lernus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕlernus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grove by the Tiber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of Carna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:105" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
helia: <entryFree id="n20355" type="main" key="Helia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Helia</orth>, v. Velia.</entryFree>
heliacus: <entryFree id="n20356" type="greek" key="He_li^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēlĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(hliako/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to Helios</hi> (the sun): <cit><quote lang="la">Heliaca tradere,</quote> <trans><tr>to offer sacrifices to Helios</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2343</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
heliades: <entryFree id="n20357" type="main" key="He_li^a^de^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēlĭădĕs</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(hlia/des</foreign>, <sense id="n20357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughters of Helios and sisters of Phaëthon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who were changed into poplars</hi> (acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">into alders</hi>) <hi rend="ital">and their tears into amber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 154" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 340</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 190</bibl>, with <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 6, 62</bibl>): nemus Heliadum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">poplar</hi>- or <hi rend="ital">alder-grove</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Heliadum lacrimae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>amber</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:263" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 263</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also: Heliadum gemma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:14:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 14, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence: capaces Heliadum crustae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of amber</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:38" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
helianthes: <entryFree id="n20358" type="greek" key="he_li^anthes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēlĭanthes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(lianqe/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sunflower</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 165</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
helicaon: <entryFree id="n20359" type="main" key="He^li^ca_on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕlĭcāon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(elika/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n20359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Antenor and founder of Patavium</hi> (Padua): <cit><quote lang="la">Helicaonis orae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Patavian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:93:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 93, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕlĭcāŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio, the same,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:152:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 152, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
helice: <entryFree id="n20360" type="greek" key="he^li^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕlĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(li/kh</foreign> (a winding). <sense id="n20360.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of slender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flexible willow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 37, 69, § 177</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20360.1" n="II" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">nom. propr.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕlĭcē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n20360.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The constellation of the Great Bear</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 20, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:108" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:17" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 17</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the North</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyneg. 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1539" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1539</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20360.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A maritime town of Achaia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swallowed up by the sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 293</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 92, 94, § 206</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:23:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 23, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
helichrysos: <entryFree id="n20361" type="greek" key="he^li^chry_^sos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕlĭchrȳ^sos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-um</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(li/xrusos</foreign>, <sense id="n20361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the herb marigold</hi>, Gnaphalium stoechas, Linn.; acc. to others, Tanacetum annuum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:65 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 38, § 65 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:168" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 25, 96, § 168</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
helicon: <entryFree id="n20362" type="main" key="He^li^con"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕlĭcon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(elikw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n20362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Bœotia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacred to Apollo and the Muses</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Zagará</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 3, 4, § 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 7, 12, § 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 219</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 254</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">663</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:193" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 193</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:641" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 641</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 163 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n20362.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n20362.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕlĭcōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Helicon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Heliconian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Helicon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tempe,</quote> <trans><tr>a beautiful valley on Mount Helicon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud.
