Ser. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Naïs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epigr. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20362.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕlĭcōnĭădes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Heliconians</hi>, a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> designation of <hi rend="ital">the Muses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1037" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1037</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20362.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕlĭcōnis</orth>, ĭdis. <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Heliconian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:4:90" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 4, 90</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕlĭcōnĭdes</orth>, <cb n="HELL" /> um, i. q. Heliconiades, <hi rend="ital">the Muses</hi>, Pers. prooem. 4.</sense></entryFree>
heliocallis: <entryFree id="n20363" type="greek" key="he_li^o^callis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēlĭŏcallis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(liokalli/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sunflower</hi>, also called helianthes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 165</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
heliocaminus: <entryFree id="n20364" type="greek" key="he_li^o^ca^mi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēlĭŏcămīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(lioka/minos</foreign>, <sense id="n20364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an apartment exposed to the sun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">used as a winter abode</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 2, 18</bibl> pr.</sense></entryFree>
heliodorus: <entryFree id="n20365" type="main" key="He_li^o^do_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēlĭŏdōrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n20365.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated surgeon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:372" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 372</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20365.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated rhetorician</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
heliogabalus: <entryFree id="n20366" type="main" key="He_li^o^ga^ba^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēlĭŏgăbălus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Elagab-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman emperor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 23" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Car. 11 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
heliopolis: <entryFree id="n20367" type="main" key="He_li^o^po^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēlĭŏpŏlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(hlio/polis</foreign>. <sense id="n20367.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Lower Egypt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:21:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 21, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 23, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20367.1" n="B" level="2"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n20367.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hē-lĭŏpŏlītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Heliopolis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Heliopolite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 9, § 49</bibl></cit>: Zeus, <hi rend="ital">an Assyrian designation of</hi> Sol, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 23</bibl>; cf. in the foll.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēlĭŏpŏlītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Heliopolis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Heliopolites</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 26, 67, § 197</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20367.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēlĭŏpŏlītānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Heliopolis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Heliopolitan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">JVPPITER,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1234</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1246</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēlĭŏ-pŏlītāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Heliopolis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Heliopolitans</hi>, Inscr. ap. Marin. Fratr. Arv. p. 542.—</sense><sense id="n20367.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Cœlesyria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the foot of Libanus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Baalbek</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 22, 18, § 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
helioscopion: <entryFree id="n20368" type="greek" key="he_li^osco^pi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēlĭoscŏpĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(liosko/pion</foreign>, <sense id="n20368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of</hi> heliotropium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 29, § 57</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also: helioscopum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
helioscopios: <entryFree id="n20369" type="greek" key="he_li^osco^pi^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēlĭoscŏpĭos</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(liosko/pios</foreign>, <sense id="n20369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of</hi> tithymalus or <hi rend="ital">spurge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 42, § 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
helioselinum: <entryFree id="n20370" type="main" key="he^li_o^se^li_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕlīŏsĕlīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. heleoselinon.</entryFree>
heliotropium: <entryFree id="n20371" type="greek" key="he_li^o^tro^pi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēlĭŏtrŏpĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(liotro/pion</foreign>. <sense id="n20371.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The plant turnsole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heliotrope</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:46" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 41, 41, § 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:57" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 21, 29, § 57</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n20371.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A precious stone with green and brown streaks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">striped jasper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 60, § 165</bibl>.—Called also: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hēlĭŏtrŏpĭos</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">gemma</orth>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">heliotropius lapis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Perieg. 254</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
helix: <entryFree id="n20372" type="greek" key="he^lix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕlix</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(/lic</foreign> (wound, twisted). <sense id="n20372.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of ivy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:9:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 9, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 34, 62, § 145</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n20372.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of willow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 37, 69, § 177</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20372.2" n="III" level="1"> In archit., <hi rend="ital">a whorl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a small ornament on the capital of Corinthian columns</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
helladicus: <entryFree id="n20373" type="main" key="Hella^di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hellădĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(elladiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from Greece</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Grecian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Greek</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus picturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hellanicus: <entryFree id="n20374" type="main" key="Hella_ni_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hellānīcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek historian of Lesbos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an older contemporary of Herodotus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:12:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 12, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:23" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hellas: <entryFree id="n20375" type="main" key="Hellas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hellas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ella/s</foreign>. <sense id="n20375.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Hellas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the main-land of Greece</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:3 sq" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 11, § 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20375.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A female proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 277</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
helle: <entryFree id="n20376" type="main" key="Helle_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hellē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype> (<sense id="n20376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Hellis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 41</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(/ellh</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Athamas and Nephele</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sister of Phrixus; she fled with the latter from her step-mother Ino on a ram with a golden fleece to Colchis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but was drowned in the strait called</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after her</hi>, Hellespontus (the sea of Helle), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 195</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:857 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 857 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:26:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 26, 5</bibl> (3, 21, 5 M.); 3 (4), 22, 5; Col. poët. 10, 155; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 2" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 2</bibl> and 3: <cit><quote lang="la">Mater Helles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 123</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
helleborine: <entryFree id="n20377" type="greek" key="helle^bo^ri_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hellĕbŏrīnē</orth>, v. elleborine.</entryFree>
helleborus: <entryFree id="n20378" type="greek" key="helle^bo^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hellĕbŏrus</orth>, etc., v. elleborus, etc.</entryFree>
hellen: <entryFree id="n20379" type="main" key="Helle_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hellēn</orth>, <itype>ēnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(/ellhn</foreign>, <sense id="n20379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Deucalion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and king of Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from whom the Greeks were called Hellenes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 14, § 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hellespontus: <entryFree id="n20380" type="main" key="Hellespontus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hellespontus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ellh/spontos</foreign>, <sense id="n20380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Sea of Helle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Hellespont</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so named after</hi> Helle, <hi rend="ital">who was drowned in it</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">Dardanelles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:3:1" default="NO">1, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:75" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 12, 24, § 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:92" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 13, 27, § 92</bibl>; Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 21</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 371 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:34:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 34, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 407</bibl> et saep.—Separate: qua ponto ab Helles, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:49:163" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 49, 163</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pure Lat.: mare in Helles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:15" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20380.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the shores of the Hellespont</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the land around the Propontis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:53:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 53, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:24:section=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 24, § 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 33, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20380.2" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n20380.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hel-lespontĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging</hi> <cb n="HELV" /> <hi rend="ital">to the Hellespont</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hellespontic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 18, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Epit. 5, 1</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Helles-pontĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who lives upon the Hellespont</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid habebit cum aliquo Hellespontio controversiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:53:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 53, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 32, § 123</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20380.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hellespontĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Hellespontic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:24" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Priapus (because born and worshipped in Lampsacus, a city on the Hellespont),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 111</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20380.5" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hellespontĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">fretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:18:5" default="NO">1, 18, 5</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n20380.6" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hellespontĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">another name of the wind</hi> Caecias, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 46, § 121</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
helluatio: <entryFree id="n20381" type="main" key="hellu^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hellŭātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">hēl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>helluor</etym>, <sense id="n20381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gormandizing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gluttony</hi>, Pseudo-Cic. Or. Post Red. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:6:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> 6, 13</bibl>; Treb. Poll. Gall. 4.</sense></entryFree>
helluo: <entryFree id="n20382" type="main" key="hellu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hellŭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">hēluo</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gormandizer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glutton</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squanderer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraus, helluo, Ganeo!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille gurges atque helluo, natus abdomini suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:17:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ipsum ut contempsit helluo patriae!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 11, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
helluor: <entryFree id="n20383" type="main" key="hellu^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hellŭor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">hēluor</orth>), <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n20383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [helluo], <hi rend="ital">to gormandize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devour</hi> (Ciceron.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">decoquo, abligurio): cum Graecis jam in exostra helluabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:52:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 52, 111</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi helluari libris, si hoc verbo in tam clara re utendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille gurges helluatus tecum simul rei publicae sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:47:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 47, 124</bibl></cit>.!*? Helluatus as <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cat. 5, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hellusii: <entryFree id="n20384" type="main" key="Hellusii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hellusii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a German tribe</hi>, mentioned only by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
helops: <entryFree id="n20385" type="greek" key="he^lops"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕlops</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlops</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ellops</orth>), <itype>ŏpis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/lloy</foreign>, <sense id="n20385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very savory sea-fish</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the sword-fish;</hi> acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">the sturgeon</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Hed. 6</bibl> (p. 166 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:96" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:6:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 17, 27, § 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:153" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 54, § 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:16:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 16, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
helorus: <entryFree id="n20386" type="main" key="He^lo_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕlōrus</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Elōrus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/elwros</foreign> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕlōrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/elwron</foreign>, <sense id="n20386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river on the eastern coast of Sicily</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Atellaro</hi>, al. <hi rend="ital">Abisso</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:698" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 698</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:34:section=90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 34, § 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:269" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 269</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen Elorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 89</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">At its mouth</hi> was situated the city <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕlōrus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">El-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 35 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 7, § 16</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the vale</hi> of which was called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕlōrĭa Tempē</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:477" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 477</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕlōrīni</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">El-</orth>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:43:section=103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 43, § 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
helotes: <entryFree id="n20387" type="main" key="He^lo_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕlōtes</orth>, v. Hilotae.</entryFree>
heluatio: <entryFree id="n20388" type="main" key="he_lua_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēluātio</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">hēluo</orth>, etc., v. helluatio, etc.</entryFree>
helus: <entryFree id="n20389" type="gloss" key="helus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">helus</orth>, v. holus <sense id="n20389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
helvacea: <entryFree id="n20390" type="gloss" key="helvacea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">helvacea</orth> <itype>genus ornamenti Lydii, dictum a colore boum, qui est inter rufum et album appellaturque helvus</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=99" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 99</bibl> Müll. <sense id="n20390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
helvecones: <entryFree id="n20391" type="main" key="Helveco_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Helvecōnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a northern Germanic tribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the Rugii and Burgundiones</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the west of the Vistula</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
helvella: <entryFree id="n20392" type="main" key="helvella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">helvella</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">helvēla</orth>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=103" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 103</bibl> Müll.), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>‡ helus, i. q. olus</etym>, <sense id="n20392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small potherb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fungos, helvellas, herbas omnes ita condiunt, ut nihil possit esse suavius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 26, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: helvela olera minuta, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=103" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 103</bibl>: helvola <foreign lang="greek">laxana/ria</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
helvenacus: <entryFree id="n20393" type="main" key="helve^na_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">helvĕnācus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>helvus</etym>, <sense id="n20393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pale yellow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yellowish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <trans><tr>a particular kind of wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus palmitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 24, § 47</bibl></cit>.—Also: <orth extent="full" lang="la">helvĕnācĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:55" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
helveolus: <entryFree id="n20394" type="main" key="helve^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">helvĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pale yellow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yellowish</hi>: vinum, <hi rend="ital">a particular kind of wine</hi> (cf. helvenacus and helvolus), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24, 2</bibl> (quoted, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 5, § 46</bibl>, in the form helvinum vinum). Also in the form helvolus, a, um: <cit><quote lang="la">uvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:23" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
helvetii: <entryFree id="n20395" type="main" key="Helve_ti^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Helvētĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Helvetians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Gallia Lugdunensis, in modern <hi rend="ital">Switzerland</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 17, 31, § 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 13, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 14, 32</bibl> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n20395.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n20395.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Helvētĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Helvetians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Helvetian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20395.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Helvētĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 9, 6</bibl></cit>. <pb n="846" /> <cb n="HEMI" /></sense></entryFree>
helvidius: <entryFree id="n20396" type="main" key="Helvi^dius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Helvĭdius</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n20396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:70:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 70, 198</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:36 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 36 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
helvii: <entryFree id="n20397" type="main" key="Helvi^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Helvĭi</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Helvi</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, <hi rend="ital">whose capital</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called</hi> Alba Helvorum <hi rend="ital">and</hi> Alba Helvia, <hi rend="ital">was celebrated for its wine</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Alps</hi>, in <hi rend="ital">Viviers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Départ. Ardèche</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:43" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 3, 4, § 43</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n20397.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Helvĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Helvii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Helvian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
helvina: <entryFree id="n20398" type="main" key="Helvi_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Helvīna</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Elv-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of Ceres</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:320" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 320</bibl> [perh. from the Gallic people Helvii].</sense></entryFree>
helvinus: <entryFree id="n20399" type="main" key="helvi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">helvĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. helveolus.</entryFree>
helvius: <entryFree id="n20400" type="main" key="Helvi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Helvĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n20400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 266</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">85 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
helvolus: <entryFree id="n20401" type="main" key="helvo^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">helvŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. helveolus.</entryFree>
helvus: <entryFree id="n20402" type="main" key="helvus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">helvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perh. a weakened form of gilvus, yellow</etym>, <sense id="n20402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">light bay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color vaccarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: color boum, qui est inter rufum et album, appellatur helvus, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. ‡ helvacea, p. 99 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
helxine: <entryFree id="n20403" type="greek" key="helxi_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">helxīnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(lci/nh</foreign>. <sense id="n20403.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A prickly plant</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 16, 56, § 94</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20403.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise called</hi> perdicium: Parietaria officinalis, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 17, 19, § 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hem: <entryFree id="n20404" type="main" key="hem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hem</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">em</orth>, and often confounded in MSS. and edd. with em and en, q. v.), <pos>interj.</pos>, an expression of surprise, in a good or bad sense; of admiration, joy, of grief, indignation, etc. (like the intensive ehem, an expression of joyful surprise), <sense id="n20404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">oho! indeed! well! well to be sure! hah! alas! alack! Ag.</hi> Ego sum ipsus, quem tu quaeris. <hi rend="ital">Ha.</hi> Hem! quid ego audio? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 86</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hem, Pamphile, optime te mihi offers,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Er.</hi> Itane Chrysis? hem! <hi rend="ital">My.</hi> Nos quidem pol miseras perdidit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 5, 8</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 1, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserum me! quanto haec dixi cum dolore! hem, Postume, tune es, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:17:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 17, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occepi mecum cogitare: hem, biduum hic Manendum est soli sine illa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hem tibi maledictis pro istis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hem, quid ais, scelus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">audistin', obsecro? hem scelera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 47</bibl></cit>: hem nos homunculi indignamur, si quis, etc., Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hemeresios: <entryFree id="n20405" type="greek" key="he_me^re_si^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēmĕrēsĭos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(merh)sios</foreign>, <sense id="n20405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a day</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Pamphilus) absolvit uno die tabellam, quae vocata est Hemeresios, puero picto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 124</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hemeris: <entryFree id="n20406" type="greek" key="he_me^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēmĕris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(meri/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of oak</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 6, 8, § 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:26" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 6, 9, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hemerobion: <entryFree id="n20407" type="greek" key="he_me^ro^bi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēmĕrŏbĭon</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(mero/bion</foreign>, <sense id="n20407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an insect that lives but a day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an ephemeron</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erumpit volucre quadrupes, nec ultra unum diem vivit, unde hemerobion vocatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 36, 43, § 120</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hemerocalles: <entryFree id="n20408" type="greek" key="he_me^ro^calles"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēmĕrŏcalles</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(merokalle/s</foreign> (one day beautiful), <sense id="n20408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of lily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the daylily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 10, 33, § 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:158" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 21, 90, § 158</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hemerodromus: <entryFree id="n20409" type="greek" key="he_me^ro^dro^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēmĕrŏdrŏmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(merodro/mos</foreign> (who runs the day through), <sense id="n20409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a courier</hi> (pure Lat. cursor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 71, 73, § 181</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">nisi speculator (hemerodromos vocant Graeci) ingens die uno cursu emetiens spatium, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 24, 4</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">hemerodromœ,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 4, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hemicadium: <entryFree id="n20410" type="greek" key="he_mi^ca^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēmĭcădĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(mika/dion</foreign>, <sense id="n20410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the half of a</hi> cadus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 20, 7, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hemicillus: <entryFree id="n20411" type="greek" key="he_mi^cillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēmĭcillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(mi/killos</foreign>, <sense id="n20411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mule</hi>, as a term of reproach, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:51:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 51, 1</bibl> (dub.; al. Micyllus).</sense></entryFree>
hemicranium: <entryFree id="n20412" type="greek" key="he_mi^cra_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēmĭcrānĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">hēmĭ-crānia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(mikra/nion</foreign>, <sense id="n20412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pain on one side of the head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">headache</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 2</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.;</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1</bibl>. 8.—Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">hēmĭ-crānĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">sufferers from headache</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hemicyclium: <entryFree id="n20413" type="greek" key="he_mi^cyclium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēmĭcyclium</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(miku/klion</foreign>, <sense id="n20413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half-circle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">semicircle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20413.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n20413.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A semicircular recess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with seats</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20413.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A semicircular public place furnished with rows of seats for learned discussions</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20413.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A semicircular kind of sundial</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hemicyclus: <entryFree id="n20414" type="greek" key="he_mi^cyclus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēmĭcyclus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(mi/kuklos</foreign>, <sense id="n20414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> <cb n="HENO" /> <hi rend="ital">half-circle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">semicircle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl>, Serm. 12, 20.</sense></entryFree>
hemicylindrus: <entryFree id="n20415" type="greek" key="he_mi^cy^lindrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēmĭcylindrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(miku/lindros</foreign>, <sense id="n20415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half-cylinder</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hemina: <entryFree id="n20416" type="greek" key="he_mi_na1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēmīna</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ēmīna</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(mi/na</foreign>, <sense id="n20416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a measure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the half of a</hi> sextarius, <bibl default="NO"><author>Rhem. Fan.</author> de Pond. 67</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for liquids,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 57, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 18</bibl>; Sen. de Ira, 2, 33; <cit><quote lang="la">for salt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for corn,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; as a <hi rend="ital">measure</hi>, in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:129" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 129</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n20417" type="main" key="He_mi_na2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēmīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">surname of the historian</hi> L. Cassius.</sense></entryFree>
heminaria: <entryFree id="n20418" type="hapax" key="he_mi_na_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēmīnārĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>hemina</etym>, <sense id="n20418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">presents of the measure of a</hi> hemina: <cit><quote lang="la">Fabius Maximus incusans Augusti congiariorum, quae amicis dabantur, exiguitatem heminaria esse dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hemiolios: <entryFree id="n20419" type="greek" key="he_mi^o^li^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēmĭŏlĭos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(mio/lios</foreign>, <sense id="n20419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one and a half</hi> (pure Lat. sesquialter), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:14:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 14, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. hemisphaerium: <entryFree id="n20421" type="greek" key="he_misphaeri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēmisphaerĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(misfai/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n20421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half-globe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hemisphere.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20421.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. Cic. Verr. 2, 1, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

Cap.</author> 9, § 930</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">963</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 4:14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 1, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

hemitritaeus: <entryFree id="n20427" type="greek" key="he_mi^tri^taeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēmĭtrĭtaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(mitritai=os</foreign>. <sense id="n20427.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A semi-tertian ague</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:91:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 91, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:40:1" default="NO">2, 40, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:22:133" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 22, 133</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 52</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 3</bibl>, written as Greek).—</sense><sense id="n20427.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who has the semi-tertian ague</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:81:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 81, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

Emp.</author> 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:10" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

hendecasyllabi: <entryFree id="n20430" type="greek" key="hende^ca^sylla^bi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hendĕcăsyllăbi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(ndekasu/llaboi</foreign>, <sense id="n20430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">verses of eleven syllables</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 12, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 14, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 4, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 509</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
heneti: <entryFree id="n20431" type="main" key="He^ne^ti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕnĕti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. Veneti.</entryFree>

Fl.</author> 6, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 1048" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 1048</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n20432.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n20432.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēnĭŏchus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Heniochi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Heniochian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:26" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20432.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hē-nĭŏchĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 9, 10, § 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
heniochus: <entryFree id="n20433" type="main" key="He_ni^o^chus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēnĭŏchus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Heniochi, II. A.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n20434" type="greek" key="He_ni^o^chus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēnĭŏchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(hni/oxos</foreign> (rein-holder), <sense id="n20434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the constellation of the Wagoner</hi>, pure Lat. Auriga, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 31, 74, § 312</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 361</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 3:12" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 3, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48:section=107 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48, § 107 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:422" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 422</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">455</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">462</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:F. 146" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> F. 146</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20435.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n20435.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hennensis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Enn-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Henna</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ceres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:49:section=107 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 49, § 107 sq.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hen-nenses</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Enn-</orth>), <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Henna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48:section=106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48, § 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 91</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20435.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hennaeus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Enn-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Henna</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hennean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Henna</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 385</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo rapta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:245" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 245</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 93</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

hepatites: <entryFree id="n20442" type="greek" key="he_pa^ti_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēpătītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(pati/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n20442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the liver-stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 20, 38, § 147</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

hepatizon: <entryFree id="n20444" type="greek" key="he_pa^ti_zon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēpătīzon</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(pati/zon</foreign>, <sense id="n20444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like liver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">liver-colored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes Corinthium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 2, 3, § 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hephaestia: <entryFree id="n20445" type="main" key="He_phaesti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēphaestĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Lemnos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 35, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hephaestio: <entryFree id="n20446" type="main" key="He_phaesti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēphaestĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(hfaisti/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n20446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a favorite of Alexander the Great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and one of his generals</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:12:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 12, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:16" default="NO">4, 16, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hephaestitis: <entryFree id="n20447" type="greek" key="he_phaesti_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēphaestītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(faisti=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n20447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 60, § 166</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hephthemimeres: <entryFree id="n20448" type="greek" key="hephthe_mi^me^res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hephthēmĭmĕres</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(fqhmimerh/s</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">tomh/</foreign>), in hexameter or Iambic verse, <sense id="n20448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the cœsura which occurs after the first half of the fourth foot</hi>, Lat. semiseptenaria (insectio), <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 497, 9</bibl> and 23; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> de Cent. Metr. 1817</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
hepsema: <entryFree id="n20449" type="greek" key="hepse_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hepsēma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(/yhma</foreign>, <sense id="n20449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">must boiled down to a thick consistence</hi>, pure Lat. sapa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 9, 11, § 80</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
heptagoniae: <entryFree id="n20450" type="main" key="Hepta^go_ni^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Heptăgōnĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small place near Sparta</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 38, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
heptagonos: <entryFree id="n20451" type="greek" key="hepta^go_nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">heptăgōnos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(pta/gwnos</foreign>, <sense id="n20451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">seven-cornered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having seven angles</hi>, Boëth. Arithm. 2, 6, p. 1021.</sense></entryFree>
heptaneuros: <entryFree id="n20452" type="main" key="hepta^neuros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">heptăneuros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
heptaphonos: <entryFree id="n20453" type="greek" key="hepta^pho_nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">heptăphōnos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(pta/fwnos</foreign>, <sense id="n20453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">seven times sounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that gives a sevenfold echo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticus (Olympiae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 23, § 100</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
heptaphyllon: <entryFree id="n20454" type="greek" key="hepta^phyllon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">heptăphyllon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(pta/fullon</foreign> (seven-leaf), <sense id="n20454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
heptapleuros: <entryFree id="n20455" type="greek" key="hepta^pleuros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">heptăpleuros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(pta/pleuros</foreign> (seven-sided), <sense id="n20455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the larger kind of the plant</hi> plantago, <hi rend="ital">the greater plantain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 39, § 80</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
heptapylos: <entryFree id="n20456" type="greek" key="Hepta^py^los"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Heptăpylos</orth>, <itype>on</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <sense id="n20456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">c.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>, <gen>n.</gen>), <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(pta/pulos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">seven-gated</hi>, an epithet of the city of Thebes: <cit><quote lang="la">Thebas Heptapylos accessimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 146</bibl></cit>.—Also in Latinized form: <cit><quote lang="la">Cadmus Thebas Heptapylas condidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:F. 275" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> F. 275</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
heptas: <entryFree id="n20457" type="greek" key="heptas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">heptas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(pta/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the number seven</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 108</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, § 738</bibl> (in <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
heptasemos: <entryFree id="n20458" type="greek" key="hepta^se_mos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">heptăsēmos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(pta/shmos</foreign>; in prosody, <sense id="n20458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of seven times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">containing seven units of time</hi> (pure Lat. septenarius): <cit><quote lang="la">basis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 505</bibl></cit> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 978</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
heptastadium: <entryFree id="n20459" type="greek" key="Heptasta^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Heptastădĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(eptasta/dion</foreign>, <sense id="n20459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mole of seven stadia in length</hi>, <hi rend="ital">connecting the isle of Pharos with the mainland</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 16, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
heptasyllabus: <entryFree id="n20460" type="greek" key="hepta^sylla^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">heptăsyllăbus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(ptasu/llabos</foreign>, <sense id="n20460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">seven - syllabled</hi>, Mar. Victor. p. 2613.</sense></entryFree>
heptateuchos: <entryFree id="n20461" type="greek" key="Hepta^teuchos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Heptăteuchos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(epta/teuxos</foreign>, <sense id="n20461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the first seven books of the Old Testament</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hepteris: <entryFree id="n20462" type="greek" key="hepte_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">heptēris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(pth/rhs</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">nau=s</foreign>), <sense id="n20462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a galley with seven banks of oars</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 23, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 24, 3</bibl> and 30, 2. <pb n="847" /> <cb n="HERA" /></sense></entryFree>
hera: <entryFree id="n20463" type="main" key="he^ra1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕra</orth>, v. era.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n20464" type="main" key="He_ra2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(/hra</foreign>, <sense id="n20464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Grecian goddess Hera</hi>, corresp. to the <hi rend="ital">Juno</hi> of the Romans, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2225</bibl> (although here, perh., HERA is i. q. FORTVNA). —</sense><sense id="n20464.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēraea</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(hrai=a, ta/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the festival of Hera</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:30:9 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 30, 9 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n20465" type="main" key="He_ra3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(/hra</foreign>, <sense id="n20465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">another name of</hi> Hybla Minor <hi rend="ital">in Sicily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
heraclea: <entryFree id="n20466" type="main" key="He_racle_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēraclēa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēraclīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(hra/kleia</foreign> (city of Heracles or Hercules), <sense id="n20466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several cities.</hi>—In partic. </sense><sense id="n20466.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A seaport of Lucania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the river Siris</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a colony of Tarentum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and the birthplace of the painter Zeuxis</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Policoro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 15, § 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20466.2" n="B" level="2"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēraclēen-ses</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēraclīenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Heraclea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Heracleans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:4:6 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 4, 6 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 8, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20466.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A very ancient city of Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a colony from Crete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called in earlier times</hi> Minoa, now <hi rend="ital">Capo Bianco</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:16" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:50:section=125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 50, § 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:40" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20466.4" n="B" level="2"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēraclēenses</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēraclīenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Heraclea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Heracleans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20466.5" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Phthiotis in Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Thermopylœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a colony of Sparta</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formerly</hi> Trachis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:5:13 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 5, 13 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:5:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 5, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20466.6" n="IV" level="1"> Heraclea Sintica or Heraclea ex Sintiis, <hi rend="ital">a city in Pœonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the western bank of the Strymon</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Melenik</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:79:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 79, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:51:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 51, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20466.7" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A maritime town of Pontus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also with the epithet</hi> Pontica, now <hi rend="ital">Erekli</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Eregri</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 1, 1, § 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
heracleopolis: <entryFree id="n20467" type="main" key="He_ra_cle^o^po^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hērāclĕŏpŏlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(hrakle/ous po/lis</foreign>, <sense id="n20467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Egypt upon an ancient island of the Nile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which has become part of its western bank</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ahnas</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 676</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hērāclĕŏpŏlītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Heracleopolis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 84</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hērāclĕŏpŏlī-tae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Heracleopolis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
heracleotes: <entryFree id="n20468" type="main" key="He_racle_o_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēraclēōtes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(hrakleiw/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n20468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Heraclea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Heracleote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">born in Heraclea</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractus,</quote> <trans><tr>in Æolis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 32, § 122</bibl></cit>: Dionysius ille, <hi rend="ital">a disciple of Zeno</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">of Heraclea in Lucania</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 22, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Zeuxis, perh. from the same place,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 9, 36, § 61</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēraclēōtae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Heraclea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Heracleotes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Caria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:56:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 56, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
heracleoticus: <entryFree id="n20469" type="main" key="He_racle_o_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēraclēōtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(hrakleiwtiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Heraclea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Heracleotic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">origanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 16, 62, § 170</bibl></cit>: nux, Opp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
heracleum: <entryFree id="n20470" type="main" key="He_ra_cle_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hērāclēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(hra/kleion</foreign>, <sense id="n20470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Macedonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the border of Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 2</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
heracleus: <entryFree id="n20471" type="main" key="He_racle_us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēraclēus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-clĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n20471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Heraclea</hi> (in Lydia), <hi rend="ital">Heraclean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis, also called Lydius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 8, 43, § 126</bibl></cit>; of <hi rend="ital">the magnet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 16, 25, § 127</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n20472" type="main" key="He^ra_cle_us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕrāclēus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-clĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n20472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Hercules;</hi> v. Hercules, II. D.</sense></entryFree>
heraclides: <entryFree id="n20473" type="main" key="He_racli_des1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēraclīdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20473.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A physician</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20473.2" n="II" level="1"> Called Ponticus, <hi rend="ital">a Greek philosopher of Heraclea in Pontus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pupil of Plato and Speusippus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and afterwards of Aristotle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:3:8 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 3, 8 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n20473.3" n="III" level="1"> Heraclides Ponticus the younger, <hi rend="ital">a grammarian</hi>, Gell. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 705</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n20473.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A painter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 135</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n20474" type="main" key="He_racli_des2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēraclīdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Hercules, II. E.</entryFree>
heracliensis: <entryFree id="n20475" type="main" key="He_racli_ensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēraclīensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. Heraclea, I. B. and II. B.</entryFree>
heraclitus: <entryFree id="n20476" type="main" key="He_ra_cli_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hērāclītus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(hra/kleitos</foreign>. <sense id="n20476.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated Greek philosopher of Ephesus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who wrote in an obscure style</hi> (hence called <foreign lang="greek">o( skoteino/s</foreign>, the Obscure), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:64:133" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 64, 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:5:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 5, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:14:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 14, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:36:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 36, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:639" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 639</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec consulto dicis occulte tamquam Heraclitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:26:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 26, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20476.1" n="B" level="2"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēraclītĕi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the disciples of Heraclitus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Doctr. Plat. 1, p. 2, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20476.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A pupil of Clitomachus and Philo</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 4, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20476.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An ambassador sent by king Philip to Hannibal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with the surname</hi> Scotinus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 39</bibl>. <cb n="HERB" /></sense></entryFree>
heraclius: <entryFree id="n20477" type="main" key="He_raclius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēraclius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. Heraclëus and Hercules, II. D.</entryFree>
heraea: <entryFree id="n20478" type="main" key="He_raea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēraea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Hera</etym>, <sense id="n20478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortified city in Arcadia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Alphēus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:7 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 7 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
heraeus: <entryFree id="n20479" type="main" key="He_raeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēraeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Hera, II.</entryFree>
herba: <entryFree id="n20480" type="main" key="herba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">herba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>old Lat. forb-ea; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">forbh/</foreign>; Sanscr. root bhar-, to nourish</etym>, <sense id="n20480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">springing vegetation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">green stalks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">blades</hi>, <hi rend="ital">green crops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">herbage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an herb</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gramen, faenum, caespes, glaeba): herba cubile Praebebat, multa et molli lanugine abundans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:816" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 816</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in molli consedimus herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ceteris in campo exercentibus in herba ipse recubuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:71:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 71, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abicere se in herba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fusus per herbam (agricola),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:527 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 527 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invitant (Pecudes) herbae gemmantes rore recenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 319</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">gemmantes rore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 461</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae rore vigentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 361</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneras per herbas Ludere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova tum tellus herbas virgultaque primum Sustulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:790" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 790</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quibusdam stirpibus et herbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:64:161" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 64, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corona ex asperis herbis et agrestibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:34:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 34, 75</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 32, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas herbas pecudes non edunt, homines edunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:23 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 23 sq.</bibl></cit>;
