cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fungos, helvellas, herbas omnes ita condiunt, ut nihil possit esse suavius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbis vivis et urticā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solstitialis herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interim mores mali Quasi herba irrigua succreverunt uberrume,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fallax veneni,</quote> <trans><tr>a poisonous plant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla neque amnem Libavit quadrupes, nec graminis attigit herbam,</quote> <trans><tr>a blade</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et sulcis frumenti quaereret herbam,</quote> <trans><tr>young crop</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novitates si spem afferunt, ut tamquam in herbis non fallacibus fructus appareat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19, 68</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">primis segetes moriuntur in herbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ceres dominum primis fallebat in herbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:645" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 645</bibl></cit>.—So prov.: saepe audivi, inter os atque offam multa intervenire posse; verum vero inter offam atque herbam, ibi vero longum intervallum est, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:17:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 17, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sed nimium properas et adhuc tua messis in herba est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 263</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">egone, qui indolem ingenii tui in germine etiam tum et in herba et in flore dilexerim, nunc frugem ipsam maturae virtutis nonne multo multoque amplius diligam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Anton. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Anton. 1, 5</bibl></cit> Mai.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis illa laus ... velut in herba vel flore praecerpta ad nullam certam et solidam pervenit frugem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Dial. 9, 5</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: herbam dare, <hi rend="ital">to own one's self beaten</hi>: herbam do cum ait Plautus, significat: victum me fateor; quod est antiquae et pastoralis vitae indicium. Nam qui in prato cursu aut viribus contendebant, cum superati erant, ex eo solo, in quo certamen erat, decerptam herbam adversario tradebant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=99" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 99</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 128</bibl>; Varr. ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 4, 4, § 8</bibl>; Att. and Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 317, 18</bibl> and 20.—</sense><sense id="n20480.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">weeds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">useless plants</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">officiant laetis ne frugibus herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 251</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 411</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 30, 72, § 300</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
herbaceus: <entryFree id="n20481" type="main" key="herba_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">herbācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>herba</etym>, <sense id="n20481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">grassy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grass-colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grass-green</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 33, § 110</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">folia herbacei coloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 13, 51, § 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 19, 75, § 128</bibl></cit> (opp. albus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 8, 35, § 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 4, 49, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chrysocolla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 5, 27, § 90</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
herbans: <entryFree id="n20482" type="main" key="herbans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">herbans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>herba</etym>, <sense id="n20482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">producing grass</hi> or <hi rend="ital">herbage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of grass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 194</bibl></cit> Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (al. herbentia).</sense></entryFree>
herbaria: <entryFree id="n20483" type="main" key="herba_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">herbārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. ars) [herba], <sense id="n20483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the knowledge of plants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">botany</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbariam et medicamentariam a Chirone volunt repertam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 196</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
herbarium: <entryFree id="n20484" type="main" key="herba_rium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">herbārium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>herbarius</etym>, <sense id="n20484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a collection of dried plants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an herbarium</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Inst. Div. Litt. 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
herbarius: <entryFree id="n20485" type="main" key="herba_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">herbārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>herba</etym>, <sense id="n20485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one skilled in plants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a botanist</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 73, § 191</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:174" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 13, 109, § 174</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
herbaticus: <entryFree id="n20486" type="main" key="herba_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">herbātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">living on grass</hi> or <hi rend="ital">herbs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grass-eating</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">animalia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 19, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
herbens: <entryFree id="n20487" type="main" key="herbens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">herbens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, v. herbans.</entryFree>
herbesco: <entryFree id="n20488" type="main" key="herbesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">herbesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n20488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to grow into green stalks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">blades</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">elicere herbescentem viriditatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi semper herbescunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 2, 19</bibl></cit>. <cb n="HERC" /></sense></entryFree>
herbessus: <entryFree id="n20489" type="main" key="Herbessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Herbessus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Herbēsus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Sicily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:30 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 30 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
herbeus: <entryFree id="n20490" type="hapax" key="herbe^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">herbĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>herba</etym>, <sense id="n20490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">grasscolored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grass-green</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
herbido: <entryFree id="n20491" type="main" key="herbi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">herbĭdo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>herbidus</etym>, <sense id="n20491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to give a grassy appearance to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
herbidus: <entryFree id="n20492" type="main" key="herbi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">herbĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>herba</etym>. <sense id="n20492.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Full of grass</hi> or <hi rend="ital">herbs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grassy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epiros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segetes,</quote> <trans><tr>full of weeds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potus,</quote> <trans><tr>obtained from herbs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 6, 19, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulae herbidae omnes harundine et junco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n20492.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Like grass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grassy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grass-colored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">folium herbidi coloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 31, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 863</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
herbifer: <entryFree id="n20493" type="main" key="herbi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">herbĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>herba-fero</etym>, <sense id="n20493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">producing grass</hi> or <hi rend="ital">herbs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grassy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">herbiferous</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">colles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:468" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 468</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pelius mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 53, § 94</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
herbigradus: <entryFree id="n20494" type="hapax" key="herbi^gra^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">herbĭgrădus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>herbagradior</etym>, <sense id="n20494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">going in the grass</hi>, a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of the snail, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:64:133" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 64, 133</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
herbilis: <entryFree id="n20495" type="main" key="herbi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">herbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>herba</etym>, <sense id="n20495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fed with grass</hi>: anser, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 129</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=100" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 100</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
herbipotens: <entryFree id="n20496" type="hapax" key="herbi^po^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">herbĭpŏtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>herba-potens</etym>, <sense id="n20496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">skilled in herbs</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): manus (Circes), Boëth. Cons. 4, 3, 9.</sense></entryFree>
herbita: <entryFree id="n20497" type="main" key="Herbi^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Herbĭta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(erbi/ta</foreign>, <sense id="n20497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Sicily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:32:section=75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 32, § 75</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20497.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Herbĭtensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Herbita</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Herbitan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:18:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 18, § 47</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Herbĭtenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Herbita</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Herbitans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:65:section=156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 65, § 156</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
herbo: <entryFree id="n20498" type="main" key="herbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">herbo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. herbans.</entryFree>
herbosus: <entryFree id="n20499" type="main" key="herbo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">herbōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n20499.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Full of grass</hi> or <hi rend="ital">herbs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grassy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 18, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Palatia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:25" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apidanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pascua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:689" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 689</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:367" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 367</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbosissima stramenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 54, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20499.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Grass-colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grass - green</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">marmor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 5, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcei smaragdineae fluctu viriditatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
herbula: <entryFree id="n20500" type="main" key="herbu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">herbŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little herb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervae perpurgant se quadam herbula, quae seselis dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:50:127" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 50, 127</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
herbuscula: <entryFree id="n20501" type="main" key="herbuscu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">herbuscŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little herb</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 100</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
herceus: <entryFree id="n20502" type="greek" key="Herce_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hercēus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(erkei=os</foreign> (of or belonging to the court-yard), <sense id="n20502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epithet of Jupiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as the protector of the house and its enclosure</hi> (pure Lat. Penetralis): Herceus Juppiter intra conseptum domus cujusque colebatur, quem etiam deum penetralem appellabant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=101" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 101</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:F. 91" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> F. 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 469" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 469</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 2, 469</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ara Hercei Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:286" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 286</bibl></cit> (al. Rhoetei).—Hence, also: <cit><quote lang="la">Herceae arae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:979" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 979</bibl></cit> (dub.).</sense></entryFree>
hercisco: <entryFree id="n20503" type="main" key="hercisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hercisco</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ercisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>contr. from herctum or erctum and cisco, as a <hi rend="ital">v. inch.</hi> from cieo; cf. herctum</etym>, in the old jurid. lang., <sense id="n20503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to proceed to the division of an inheritance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to divide an inheritance.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20503.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">idcirco qui, quibus verbum herctum cieri oporteat, nesciat, idem herciscundae familiae causam agere non possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:56:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 56, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbitrum familiae herciscundae postulavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 7, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 229</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20503.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos viae herciscundae contendentes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>disputing as to which way we should take</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 186</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hercle: <entryFree id="n20504" type="main" key="hercle"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hercle</orth>, v. Hercules, I. B.</entryFree>
herctum: <entryFree id="n20505" type="main" key="herctum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">herctum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">erctum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>HORCTUM et FORCTUM pro bono dicebant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=102" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 102</bibl> Müll.; perh. kindr. with heres</etym>. In the old jurid. lang., <sense id="n20505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inheritance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">estate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patrimony;</hi> only in the connection herctum (erct-) ciere (whence is derived herciscere), <hi rend="ital">to divide an inheritance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui, quibus verbum herctum cieri oporteat, nesciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:56:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 56, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herctum non citum,</quote> <trans><tr>an undivided inheritance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:9:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 9, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. Don. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 642</bibl>: herctum citum fit inter consortes, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=82" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 82</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
herculaneum: <entryFree id="n20506" type="main" key="Hercu^la_ne^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hercŭlānĕum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Hercŭlānĭum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 62</bibl>; but the modern form Herculanum is not Lat.; in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3, 1</bibl>, <pb n="848" /> <cb n="HERC" /> read Aeculanum; v. Orell. ad loc.), <itype>ĕi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(hra/kleion</foreign>, <sense id="n20506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Campania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">situated on the sea-coast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Naples and Pompeii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and buried along with the latter city by an eruption of Vesuvius</hi>, A. D. 79, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 62</bibl>; Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 207, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:16:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:16" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20506.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n20506.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Her-cŭlānĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-lanus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Herculaneum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Herculanean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 14, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 18, 18, § 72</bibl>; Cloat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 16</bibl>.—Form Herculanus: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:8:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 8, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20506.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hercŭlānensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">fundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 25, 3</bibl></cit>; for which <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: villa in Herculanensi, <hi rend="ital">in the vicinity of Herculaneum</hi>, Sen. de Ira, 3, 22. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hercŭlānenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Herculaneum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Herculaneans</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 439, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
herculaneus: <entryFree id="n20507" type="main" key="Hercu^la_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hercŭlānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Herculaneum, II. A., and Hercules, II. B.</entryFree>
herculanus: <entryFree id="n20508" type="main" key="Hercu^la_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hercŭlānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Hercules, II. C.</entryFree>
hercularia: <entryFree id="n20509" type="main" key="hercu^la_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hercŭlārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, i. q. sideritis, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hercule: <entryFree id="n20510" type="main" key="hercu^le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hercŭle</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">hercŭles</orth>, v. Hercules, I. B.</entryFree>
hercules: <entryFree id="n20511" type="main" key="Hercu^les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hercŭles</orth>, <itype>is and i</itype> (the latter in <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 34, 108</bibl> Goer.; cf. Plin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 107</bibl> P.: <sense id="n20511.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Herculei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:55:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 55, 13</bibl></cit>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(hraklh=s</foreign>, Etrusc. HERCLE (whence, by the insertion of a connecting vowel, the Latin form arose; cf. Alcumena for <foreign lang="greek">*)alkmh/nh</foreign>; v. also under B. the <case>voc.</case> hercle), <hi rend="ital">son of Jupiter and Alcmena</hi>, <hi rend="ital">husband of Dejanira</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after his deification</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Hebe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the god of strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and the guardian of riches</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to whom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">therefore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tithes were offered; he was also the guide of the Muses</hi> (Musagetes); <hi rend="ital">the poplar was sacred to him</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:16:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 16, 42</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 564</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=54" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 54</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 364</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 13</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 5, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 29</bibl>; cf. with <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:797 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 797 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque Herculi quisquam decumam vovit umquam, si sapiens factus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:36:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 36, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superavit aerumnis suis aerumnas Herculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: Herculis Columnae, <hi rend="ital">the Pillars of Hercules</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the promontories between which is the Strait of Gibraltar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 67, 67, § 167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:1:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 1, 8</bibl> et saep.—In <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et Herculum et Mercuriorum disciplinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —Prov.: Herculi quaestum conterere, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to squander everything</hi> (even the tithes of Hercules), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">personam Herculis et cothurnos aptare infantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20511.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, analog. with the Greek <foreign lang="greek">*(hra/kleis</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">*(/hrakles</foreign>, in <case>voc.</case> <orth extent="full" lang="la">hercŭles</orth>, and more freq. <orth extent="full" lang="la">hercŭle</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">hercle</orth>; also with a prefixed <hi rend="ital">me</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕ-hercŭles</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mehercŭle</orth> (also separately: <orth extent="full" lang="la">me hercule</orth>), and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕhercle</orth>, <itype>as an oath or asseveration</itype>, <hi rend="ital">by Hercules!</hi> </sense><sense id="n20511.2" n="(a)" level="5"> Hercules and mehercules: <cit><quote lang="la">et, hercules, hae quidem exstant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:16:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 16, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 4, 1</bibl>; Poll. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 10, 33, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">licet, hercules, undique omnes in me terrores impendeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 11, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:52:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 52, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque, mehercules, hoc indigne fero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:48:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 48, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui, mehercules, hic multum tribuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 18, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">at, mehercules, narrabit quod quis voluerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 17, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20511.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Hercule and mehercule, <hi rend="ital">by Hercules!</hi> (in class. prose most freq.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: impetratum est a consuetudine, ut peccare suavitatis causa liceret: et pomeridianas quadrigas quam postmeridianas libentius dixerim, et mehercule quam mehercules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:47:157" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 47, 157</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">et hercule ita fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et hercule,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 18, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:12" default="NO">2, 16, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:3" default="NO">10, 2, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 6, 4 al.: ac me quidem, ut hercule etiam te ipsum, Laeli, cognitio ipsa rerum delectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non hercule, Scipio, dubito quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed hercule facile patior datum tempus, in quo, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, C, 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:7" default="NO">12, 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">atqui nactus es, sed me hercule otiosiorem opera quam animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicam me hercule,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non me hercule, inquit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mehercule,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:74" default="NO">6, 3, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognoscere me hercule, inquit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 48</bibl></cit> Mai. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita mehercule attendi, nec satis intellexi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:14:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 14, 33</bibl></cit> Mos. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:62:section=144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 62, § 144</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vere mehercule hoc dicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:26:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 26, 64</bibl></cit>: et <cb n="HERD" /> mehercule ego antea mirari solebam, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:14:section=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 14, § 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 16, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi mehercule magnae curae est aedilitas tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi mehercule mei, si me isto pacto metuerent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20511.4" n="(g)" level="5"> Hercle and mehercle (the former esp. freq. in Plaut. and Ter.; the latter very rare): malo hercle magno suo convivat, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 474, 22</bibl> (Sat. v. 1 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">obsecro hercle, quantus et quam validus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 143</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 173</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto hercle melior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi quidem hercle non fit verisimile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio hercle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perii hercle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non hercle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per hercle rem mirandam (i. e. permirandam) Aristoteles dicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:6:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—With intensive particles: <cit><quote lang="la">heu hercle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scite hercle sane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 53</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sane quidem hercle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minime, minime hercle vero!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">minime hercle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 9, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haudquaquam hercle, Crasse, mirandum est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:22:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 22, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchre mehercle dictum et sapienter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 22</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n20511.5" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n20511.6" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hercŭlĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Hercules</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Herculean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domiti Herculea manu Telluris juvenes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coronae arbos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the poplar</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 66</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leo,</quote> <trans><tr>the lion's skin worn by Hercules</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:263" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 263</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oete,</quote> <trans><tr>on which Hercules burned himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Croto</tr>, <tr>by whom Hercules was hospitably entertained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ternox,</quote> <trans><tr>in which Hercules was begotten</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:301" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Telephus</tr>, <tr>son of Hercules</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the family of the Fabians sprung from Hercules</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:237" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 237</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">penates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:44" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrum,</quote> <trans><tr>instituted by Evander in honor of Hercules</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trachin,</quote> <trans><tr>built by Hercules</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 627</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <trans><tr>the city of Herculaneum</tr>, <tr>built by Hercules</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:711" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 711</bibl></cit>.—Hence also: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <trans><tr>near Herculaneum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:11:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tibur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>where Hercules was worshipped</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:13:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:62" default="NO">4, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">astrum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the constellation of the Lion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:55:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 55, 15</bibl></cit>: fretum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the Pillars of Hercules</hi>, (Strait of Gibraltar), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:199" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 199</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also: metae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 278</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20511.7" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hercŭlā-nĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: pars, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the tithes</hi> (dedicated to Hercules), <hi rend="ital">the tenth part</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 11</bibl>.—Also to denote things <hi rend="ital">large</hi> of their kind: <cit><quote lang="la">formicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30</bibl></cit>. 4, 10, § <cit><quote lang="la">29: urtica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 15, 55, § 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nodus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:33" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nymphaea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sideritis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">machaera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pertin. 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20511.8" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hercŭlānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: pes, i. e. <hi rend="ital">long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">large</hi> (cf. in the preced.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 1, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20511.9" n="D" level="2"> Acc. to the Gr. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēraclēus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēra-clĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(hra/kleios</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*(hra/klios</foreign>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">fabulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:52" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 52</bibl></cit> (al. acc. to the MSS. Herculeias).—</sense><sense id="n20511.10" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēraclī-des</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(hraklei/dhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a male descendant of Hercules</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Heraclid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exclusi ab Heraclīdis Orestis liberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n20511.11" n="F" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hercŭlĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a surname of the emperor Maximinianus</hi>, and hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Her-cŭlĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">his guards</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">25, 6, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
herculeus: <entryFree id="n20512" type="main" key="Hercu^le^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hercŭlĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Hercules, II. A.</entryFree>
hercynia: <entryFree id="n20513" type="main" key="Hercy^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hercynĭa silva</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(erku/nios drumo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Hercynian Forest</hi>, in ancient Germany, sixty days' journey in length and nine in width, extending from the Schwarzwald, or Black Forest, on the north-east, to the Harz, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:24 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 24 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:3:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 28</bibl>.—Called also: <cit><quote lang="la">Hercynius saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 25, § 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:132" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 47, 67, § 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 34, 4</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">Hercynium jugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 14, 28, § 100</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hercynia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
hercynna: <entryFree id="n20514" type="main" key="Hercynna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hercynna</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hercȳna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female companion of Proserpina</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to whom a temple was dedicated at Lebadia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 27, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
herdonea: <entryFree id="n20515" type="main" key="Herdo_nea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Herdōnea</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of the interior of Apulia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ordona</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:569" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 569</bibl> (perh. also in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 20, 8</bibl>, inst. of Ardoneas).—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Herdōni-enses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Herdonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
herdonius: <entryFree id="n20516" type="main" key="Herdoni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Herdonĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20516.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proper name</hi>: <cb n="HERE" /> Turnus H., <hi rend="ital">of Aricia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:50 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 50 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Appius H.,</quote> <trans><tr>a Sabine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:15 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 15 sq.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
here: <entryFree id="n20517" type="main" key="he^re1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕre</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. heri.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n20518" type="main" key="He_re_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hērē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of inheritance</hi>, Enn. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=100" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 100</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 108 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
herediolum: <entryFree id="n20519" type="main" key="he_re_di^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hērēdĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>heredium</etym>, <sense id="n20519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small inheritance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">small patrimony</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl>, praef. § 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">herediolum, majorum regna meorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex iguum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 338, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num ipsum heredioli pretium invidiosum est?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 338, 17.</sense></entryFree>
heredipeta: <entryFree id="n20520" type="main" key="he_re_di^pe^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hērēdĭpĕta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>heredium-peto</etym>, <sense id="n20520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that strives after an inheritance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a legacy-hunter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0972,001:124:2" default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> S. 124, 2</bibl>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:129" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 129</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hereditarie: <entryFree id="n20521" type="main" key="he_re_di^ta_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hērēdĭtārĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n20521.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
hereditarius: <entryFree id="n20522" type="main" key="he_re_di^ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hērēdĭtārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hereditas</etym>, <sense id="n20522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to an inheritance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inherited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hereditary</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">auctio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 5, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:10:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognomen quod habes hereditarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paupertas (with vetus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <trans><tr>an inheritance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:9" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes alienum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 3:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 84</bibl></cit> al.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hērēdĭtārĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">by inheritance</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:46:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 46, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hereditas: <entryFree id="n20523" type="main" key="he_re_di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hērēdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype> (<sense id="n20523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> hereditatium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 15, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 107 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but usu. hereditatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:7:section=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 7, § 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 3, 8</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>heres</etym>, <hi rend="ital">heirship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inheritance.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20523.1" n="I" level="1"> Abstr.: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditas est successio in universum jus, quod defunctus habebat tempore mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si istiusmodi mi fundus hereditate obvenerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:12:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 1, 1, § 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam habes istum equum, aut emeris oportet aut hereditate possideas aut, etc. ... sed neque emisti, neque hereditate venit, neque, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:45:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 45, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de hereditatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:99" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 99</bibl></cit> sqq.; 3, 1 sqq.—</sense><sense id="n20523.2" n="II" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">an inheritance</hi> (cf. patrimonium). </sense><sense id="n20523.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditas est pecunia, quae morte alicujus ad quempiam pervenit jure, nec ea aut legata testamento aut possessione retenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:6:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 6, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qua mihi obtigerit hereditas magna atque luculenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ejus filio hereditas a propinquo permagna venisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:10:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 10, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de hereditate ea, quae pupillo venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:21:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 21, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditates mihi negasti venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:16:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 16, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">communem hereditatem concedere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 36, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentio hereditatum ... hereditatem adire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:16:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 16, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adire hereditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:18:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 18, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cernere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:15:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 15, 40</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cerno: capere ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:35:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 35, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usurpare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acquirere, repudiare, omittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:58" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tradere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:33:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 33, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transmittere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 18, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem nisi in via caducae hereditates retardassent,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that fall to heirs who have children</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; v. caducus.—Prov.: hereditas sine sacris, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a great advantage without trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without expense</hi> (because the maintaining of the sacred family rites was attended with great expense), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 83</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=290" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 290</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n20523.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quo quidem rei familiaris ad paucos, cupiditatum ad multos improbos venit hereditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 8, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditas hujus gloriae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 22, 78</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">optima hereditas a patribus traditur liberis omnique patrimonio praestantior gloria virtutis rerumque gestarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 33, 121</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paternae scientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
heredito: <entryFree id="n20524" type="main" key="he_re_di^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hērēdĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to inherit</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">bona sua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> adv. Av. 3, 10 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:24:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 24, 13 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
heredium: <entryFree id="n20525" type="main" key="he_re_di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hērēdĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an hereditary estate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bina jugera quod a Romulo primum divisa viritim, quae heredem sequerentur, heredium appellarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:10:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: heredium, praedium parvulum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=99" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 99</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cat. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cat. 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in XII. Tabulis legum nostrarum nusquam nominatur villa, semper in significatione ea hortus, in horti vero heredium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 19, § 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
heremmarteam: <entryFree id="n20526" type="gloss" key="herem marteam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">herem marteam</orth> <itype>antiqui accepta hereditate colebant, quae a nomine appellabatur heredum, et esse una ex Martis comitibus putabatur</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=100" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 100</bibl> Müll. <sense id="n20526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf. heres <hi rend="ital">init.</hi> <pb n="849" /> <cb n="HERE" /></sense></entryFree>
herennius: <entryFree id="n20527" type="main" key="He_renni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hērennĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n20527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens, e. g. C. Herennius, <hi rend="ital">to whom the</hi> Rhetorica <hi rend="ital">of Cornificius is dedicated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Herennius,</quote> <trans><tr>an orator</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:45:166" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 45, 166</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:17:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 17, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herennius Gallus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">26</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">Herennius Senecio,</quote> <trans><tr>a historian under Domitian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">45</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a Samnite</hi> Herennius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:16:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 16, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20527.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hērennĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Herennius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Herennian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coheredes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
heres: <entryFree id="n20528" type="main" key="he_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēres</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ēres</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 188 al.</bibl>), ēdis (archaic <sense id="n20528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acc. sing.</hi> herem, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 486, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4379</bibl>; cf. the art. ‡ herem), <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. har-āmi, seize; har-anam, hand; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xei/r, xe/rhs</foreign>; cf. erus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">an heir</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heiress.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20528.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamento facto mulier moritur: facit heredem ex deunce et semuncia Caecinam, ex duabus sextulis M. Fulcinium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 6, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">me nemo nisi amicus fecit heredem, etc. ... aliquem palam heredem factitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:16:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 16, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier testamento fecit heredem filiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:43:section=111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 43, § 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:18:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 18, 48</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:10:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 10, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:7:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:7:9" default="NO">37, 7, 9</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Ven. Fort. Carm. 8, 6, 44: in testamento Ptolemaei patris heredes erant scripti ex duobus filiis major, et ex duabus ea, quae aetate antecedebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:108:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 108, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripserunt heredes secum M. Crassum et Q. Hortensium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:18:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 18, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem heredem testamento relinquere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relictus ab eo in amplis opibus heres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 59, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem heredem instituere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 7, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 17</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">per leges institui uxor non poterat heres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instituto herede abdicato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">substitutus heres erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:6:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: virgo Vestalis neque heres est cuiquam, etc., Labeo ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:12:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 12, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">substituere heredem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:6:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heres ex parte dimidia et tertia est Capito: in sextante sunt ii, quorum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex asse heres,</quote> <trans><tr>sole heir</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">heres ex parte sexta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 33, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex dodrante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:83" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(L. Mescinius) heres est M. Mindio fratri suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 26, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cur virgini Vestali sit heres, non sit matri suae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quem suis bonis heredem esse cupiebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 4, 12</bibl></cit>; and: atque meis bonis omnibus ego te herem faciam, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 486, 33</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: quem quis heredem suum esse voluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repentinus heres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:25:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 25, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberti heredem sequantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:7:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 7, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so the formula frequently occurring on inscriptions: HIC LOCVS, HOC MONVMENTVM HEREDEM NON SEQVITVR, USU. abbreviated H. L. or H. M. H. N. S.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4379</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3926</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4455</bibl>; 575; 2807; 4182; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">opp.: HOC MONVMENTVM HEREDEM SEQVITVR,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4397</bibl></cit>: heres secundus, <hi rend="ital">the second heir</hi>, <hi rend="ital">next heir</hi>, when the first dies: qui me secundum heredem instituerit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:61:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 61, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">possessio heredum secundorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:21:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 21, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3416</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also used of a female: Marcus ait: Heres ipsius secundus, de muliere loquens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 79</bibl></cit> P.: heres necessarius, <hi rend="ital">a slave made heir with a grant of freedom</hi>, and compelled to assume the liabilities of the estate, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:6:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 6, 1</bibl> Sandars: <cit><quote lang="la">ideo sic appellatus, quia, sive velit sive nolit, omnimodo post mortem testatoris protinus liber et heres est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:153" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 153</bibl></cit>: heres suus et necessarius, <hi rend="ital">a natural heir who was in the</hi> potestas <hi rend="ital">of the deceased</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl>, § 153; 156; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:16:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 16, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp.: heres extraneus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:section=161" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, § 161</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanti certaminis (i. e. armorum Achillis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 129</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20528.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20528.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Owner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">possessor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">master</hi> (ante-class.): heres apud antiquos pro domino ponebatur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=99" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 99</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 2:19" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 2, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apstuli hanc, quojus heres numquam erit post hunc diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. v. 28.—</sense><sense id="n20528.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A successor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after-growth</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nec ullum caput est impune recisum, quin gemino cervix herede valentior esset,</quote> <trans><tr>of the heads of the Lernean Hydra</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 74</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alni caesae densius innumero herede prosunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 37, 67, § 173</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n20528.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">illa vetus Academia atque ejus heres Aristus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:97:332" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 97, 332</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">artis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 78</bibl></cit>: criminis. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 459</bibl>. <cb n="HERM" /></sense></entryFree>
heri: <entryFree id="n20529" type="main" key="he^ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕri</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕre</orth> (in here neque e plane neque i auditur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 7</bibl>: <sense id="n20529.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">here nunc e littera terminamus: at veterum comicorum adhuc libris invenio: Heri ad me venit, quod idem in epistulis Augusti, quas sua manu scripsit aut emendavit, deprehenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 7, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 180</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1011</bibl> ib.; v. esp. Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 685), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>for hesi; cf. hes in hesternus; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> the letter <ref targOrder="U">R</ref></xr>; kindred with Sanscr. hyas; Goth. gis-tra; Germ. gestern; Engl. yesterday; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xqe/s</foreign>, orig. <foreign lang="greek">xes</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">yesterday.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20529.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20529.2" n="(a)" level="5"> Form heri (perh. only so in Cic.): Septembris heri Calendae, hodie ater dies, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 73, 33</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc heri effecit: hodie autem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 13, 1</bibl></cit> (al. here): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi est hodie, quae Lyra fulsit heri?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:76" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heri jam edixeram omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemne ego heri vidi ad vos afferri vesperi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heri vesperi apud me Hirtius fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heri vesperi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 47, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 11, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut heri dicebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum heri ipsi dixeris, te, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 180</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n20529.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Form here (a few times in Plaut., once in Cic., and after the Aug. per. most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc here effecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res hodie minor est, here quam fuit, ac eadem cras, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:23" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">here venisti mediā nocte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi quaerenti convivam dictus here illic De medio potare die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic here Phrixeae vellera pressit ovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:852" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 852</bibl></cit>: dura, anime, dura, here fortior fuisti, Gallio ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:91" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:44:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 44, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:12:2" default="NO">3, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:7:5" default="NO">4, 7, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20529.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of time just past, <hi rend="ital">a short time ago</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lately</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Papias leges heri Severus exclusit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 4</bibl></cit>;
