<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:7:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 7, § 2</bibl>: sordebant tibi villicae, Concubine, hodie atque heri, Nunc, etc., <hi rend="ital">but a short time ago</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the other day</hi> (an imitation of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xqe\s kai\ prw/hn</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:15:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 15, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
herie: <entryFree id="n20530" type="main" key="He_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hērĭē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female companion of Juno</hi>: Herie Junonis, in formula (of prayer), ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:22:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 22, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
herifuga: <entryFree id="n20531" type="hapax" key="he^ri^fu^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕrĭfŭga</orth>, v. erifuga.</entryFree>
herilis: <entryFree id="n20532" type="main" key="he^ri_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕrīlis</orth>, v. erilis.</entryFree>
herillus: <entryFree id="n20533" type="main" key="He_rillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hērillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Erillus.</entryFree>
herilus: <entryFree id="n20534" type="main" key="He_ri^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hērĭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Prœneste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of the goddess Feronia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 563</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
herinaceus: <entryFree id="n20535" type="main" key="heri^na_ceus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">herĭnāceus</orth>, v. erinaceus.</entryFree>
heritudo: <entryFree id="n20536" type="main" key="he_ri^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hērĭtūdo</orth>, v eritudo.</entryFree>
hermacreon: <entryFree id="n20537" type="main" key="Herma_creon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hermācreon</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:30:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 30, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hermaeum: <entryFree id="n20538" type="main" key="Hermaeum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hermaeum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Hermes, II.</entryFree>
hermagoras: <entryFree id="n20539" type="main" key="Herma^go^ras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hermăgŏras</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hermăgŏra</orth> (the latter is the Ciceron. form acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 61</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ermago/ras</foreign>. <sense id="n20539.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated Greek rhetorician of Rhodes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:78:271" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 78, 271</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:6:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 9, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 11, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:14" default="NO">3, 5, 14</bibl> et saep.— <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hermăgŏrēi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">his disciples</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:4" default="NO">3, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:4" default="NO">7, 4, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20539.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another rhetorician of Temnos in Æolis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the time of Augustus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hermandica: <entryFree id="n20540" type="main" key="Hermandi^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hermandĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Hispania</hi>, perh. the modern <hi rend="ital">Salamanca</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 5, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hermaphroditus: <entryFree id="n20541" type="greek" key="herma^phro^di_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hermăphrŏdītus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(rmafro/ditos</foreign>, <sense id="n20541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hermaphrodite</hi>, acc. to the myth, so called after the son of Hermes and Aphrodite, who, when bathing, grew together with Salmacis into one person: <cit><quote lang="la">gignuntur et utriusque sexus, quos hermaphroditos vocamus, olim androgynos vocatos et in prodigiis habitos, nunc vero in deliciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 3, 3, § 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:285 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 285 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">383</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 271" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 271</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:4:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 4, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20541.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <pos>adj.</pos>: hermaphroditae equae. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 49, 109, § 262</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hermarchus: <entryFree id="n20542" type="main" key="Hermarchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hermarchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n20542.0" n="I" level="1"> Of Mitylene, <hi rend="ital">a disciple of Epicurus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:30:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 30, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:33:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 33, 93</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 30, 97</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20542.1" n="II" level="1"> Of Chios, Auct. Harusp. Resp. 16, 34.</sense></entryFree>
hermathena: <entryFree id="n20543" type="main" key="Herma^the_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hermăthēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, =<foreign lang="greek">*(ermh=s-*)aqhna=</foreign>, <sense id="n20543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a double bust of Mercury and Minerva</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hermeneuma: <entryFree id="n20544" type="greek" key="herme_neuma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hermēneuma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(rmh/neuma</foreign>, <sense id="n20544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">explanation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interpretation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Excerpt. Contr. 9:3:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Excerpt. Contr. 9, 3, 4</bibl> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Contr. 26</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
hermeracles: <entryFree id="n20545" type="main" key="Herme_racles"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hermēracles</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ermh=s-*(hra</foreign><foreign lang="greek">klh=s</foreign>,<cb n="HERN" />  <sense id="n20545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a double bust of Mercury and Hercules</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 10, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hermeros: <entryFree id="n20546" type="main" key="Herme^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hermĕros</orth>, <itype>ōtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ermh=s-*)/erws</foreign>, <sense id="n20546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a double bust of Mercury and Amor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hermes: <entryFree id="n20547" type="main" key="Hermes" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hermes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Herma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ermh=s</foreign> (Hermes, Mercury; hence transf., cf. Liddell and Scott under <foreign lang="greek">*(ermh=s</foreign>), <sense id="n20547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Hermes pillar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hermes</hi>, a head carved on the top of a square pedestal or post; <cit><quote lang="la">such pillars of Hermes stood, esp. in Athens, in several public places and before private houses,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8</bibl>. 138; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:26:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 26, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:53" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 53</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20547.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hermae-um</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a temple of Hercules</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hermœum.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20547.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a summer-house</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in diaetam, cui nomen est Hermaeum, recesserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20547.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A frontier town of Bœotia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">over against Eubœa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:50:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 50, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hermestrimaximus: <entryFree id="n20548" type="main" key="Hermes Tri^maxi^mus" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hermes Trĭmaxĭmus</orth> (= <foreign lang="greek">tris me/gistos</foreign>, a surname of the Egyptian Hermes), <sense id="n20548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a philosophical writer of the second century after Christ</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 14, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hermesias: <entryFree id="n20549" type="main" key="herme_si^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hermēsĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of medical composition for children</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 166</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
herminius: <entryFree id="n20550" type="main" key="Hermi^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hermĭnĭus</orth>, a. <sense id="n20550.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Name of an ancient Roman family of Etruscan origin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:580" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 580</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20550.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Trojan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 642</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20550.2" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Herminius mons</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a mountain range of Lusitania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Alex. 48" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Alex. 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hermione: <entryFree id="n20551" type="main" key="Hermi^o^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hermĭŏnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hermĭŏna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ermio/nh</foreign>. <sense id="n20551.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of Menelāus and Helen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:11:15" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 11, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 122" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:4:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:328 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 328 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n20551.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A maritime city of Argolis</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kastri</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 41, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 9, § 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20551.2" n="B" level="2"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n20551.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hermĭŏnēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Hermione</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">statio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 471</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20551.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hermĭŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 19, § 56</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n20551.5" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hermĭŏnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:44:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 44, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hermiones: <entryFree id="n20552" type="main" key="Hermi^o_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hermĭōnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a name applied to the people of Central Germany</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from whom are descended the</hi> Suevi, Hermunduri, Chatti, and Cherusci, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 14, 28, § 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 2, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hermippus: <entryFree id="n20553" type="main" key="Hermippus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hermippus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(/ermippos</foreign>, <sense id="n20553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 19 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 4 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
hermodorus: <entryFree id="n20554" type="main" key="Hermo^do_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hermŏdōrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n20554.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Ephesian prince</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:36:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 36, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 5, 11, § 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20554.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A famous architect of Salamis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:14:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 14, 62</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hermogenes: <entryFree id="n20555" type="main" key="Hermo^ge^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hermŏgĕnes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proper name</hi>, e. g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 10 al.</bibl>; Tigellius Herm., v. Tigellius.—</sense><sense id="n20555.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hermŏgĕnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to one Hermogenes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 10</bibl></cit> 6, 1.</sense></entryFree>
hermuaeligdoeligon: <entryFree id="n20556" type="greek" key="Hermu aelig;doelig;o^n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hermu ædœŏn</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">*(ermou= ai)doi=on</foreign>, <sense id="n20556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, now unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 60, § 166</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hermubasilion: <entryFree id="n20557" type="main" key="hermu_ba^si^li_on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hermūbăsĭlīon</orth>, see the foll. art.</entryFree>
hermubotane: <entryFree id="n20558" type="greek" key="hermu_bo^ta^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hermūbŏtănē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ermou= bota/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n20558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the herb Mercury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> hermubasilion, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 82</bibl>; cf. hermupoa.</sense></entryFree>
hermula: <entryFree id="n20559" type="main" key="hermu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hermŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl>, <sense id="n20559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small Hermes pillar</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 3, 51</bibl>; Balb. de Limit. p. 142 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
hermunduri: <entryFree id="n20560" type="main" key="Hermundu^ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hermundŭri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (= <foreign lang="greek">*(ermo/ndoroi</foreign>, Strab.), <sense id="n20560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Germanic people on the Elbe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neighbors of the</hi> Chatti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 14, 28, § 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 29</bibl> sq.; 13, 57.</sense></entryFree>
hermupoa: <entryFree id="n20561" type="greek" key="hermu_po^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hermūpŏa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ermou= po/a</foreign>, <sense id="n20561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the herb Mercury</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 18, § 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hermus: <entryFree id="n20562" type="main" key="Hermus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hermus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(/ermos</foreign>, <sense id="n20562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an auriferous river in Æolis</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Sarabat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:17:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:721" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 721</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hernia: <entryFree id="n20563" type="greek" key="herni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hernĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perhaps from <foreign lang="greek">e)/rnos</foreign>, sprout, like ramex from ramus</etym>, <sense id="n20563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rupture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hernia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:13" default="NO" valid="yes">13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:24:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 24, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hernici: <entryFree id="n20564" type="main" key="Herni^ci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hernĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>herna = saxum in the Sabine and Marscar lang.</etym>, <sense id="n20564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Italian people in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the Æqui and Volsci</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40" default="NO" valid="yes">40</bibl> sq.; cf.: Hernici dicti a saxis, quae Marsi herna dicunt, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=100" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 100</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n20564.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hernĭ-cus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Hernici</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hernician</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:90" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:684" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 684</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:226" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 226</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:393" default="NO">8, 393</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:5:56" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 5, 56</bibl>. <pb n="850" /> <cb n="HERO" /> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hernĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Hernician</hi>, collect., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:180" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 180</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
herniosus: <entryFree id="n20565" type="main" key="herni^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hernĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hernia</etym>, <sense id="n20565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ruptured</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having a rupture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patruus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cat. 5, 39</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hernĭōsi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">ruptured persons</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 25, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hero: <entryFree id="n20566" type="main" key="He_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēro</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(hrw/</foreign>. <sense id="n20566.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A priestess of Aphrodite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Sestos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beloved by Leander of Abydos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who repeatedly swam to her across the Hellespont</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but at length was drowned</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18</bibl> and 19; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 16, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20566.1" n="B" level="2"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hērōus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Hero</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:955" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 955</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20566.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Danaïdes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 170" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 170</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20566.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of Priam</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 90" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
herodes: <entryFree id="n20567" type="main" key="He_ro_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hērōdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(hrw/dhs</foreign>. <sense id="n20567.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Judea</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 184</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herodis dies,</quote> <trans><tr>the Sabbath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:180" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 180</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hērōdĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Herod.</hi>—Only as <hi rend="ital">subst. plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hērōdĭā-ni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the followers of Herod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Herodians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:3:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 3, 6 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n20567.1" n="II" level="1"> Surnamed Atticus, <hi rend="ital">a celebrated Greek sophist under the Antonines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:2" default="NO">9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:12" default="NO">19, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20567.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A freedman of Atticus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
herodius: <entryFree id="n20568" type="main" key="he^ro_di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕrōdĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕrōdio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown bird</hi>, perhaps <hi rend="ital">the stork</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 14, 16</bibl> (transl. of the Hebr. <foreign />, in the Engl. transl. the little owl), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:11:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lev. 11, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
herodotus: <entryFree id="n20569" type="main" key="He_ro^do^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hērŏdŏtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(hro/dotos</foreign>, <sense id="n20569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">celebrated as the earliest Greek historian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">born at Halicarnassus</hi>, 484 B. C.: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam et apud Herodotum, patrem historiae et apud Theopompum sunt innumerabiles fabulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:13:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 13, 55</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:101" default="NO">101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:16" default="NO">9, 4, 16</bibl>; 18.</sense></entryFree>
heroice: <entryFree id="n20570" type="main" key="he_ro_i^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hērōĭcē</orth>, v. heroicus <sense id="n20570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
heroicus: <entryFree id="n20571" type="main" key="he_ro_i^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hērōĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(rwi+ko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to</hi> (mythical) <hi rend="ital">heroes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heroic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus opinio est, jam usque ab heroicis ducta temporibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:21:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 21, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Medea et Atreus, heroicae personae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:29:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 29, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublimitas heroici carminis,</quote> <trans><tr>of the heroic poem</tr>, <tr>of the epic</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">heroici carminis sonus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus, usually herous versus (v. herous),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1256</bibl></cit> P.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hērōĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the heroic style</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos quoque (versus Homeri) tamquam heroice incomptos adamavit (Vergilius),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
heroina: <entryFree id="n20572" type="greek" key="he_ro_i_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hērōīna</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">hērōīnē</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(rwi+/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n20572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a demi-goddess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heroine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:13:31" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 13, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:2:9" default="NO">2, 2, 9</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">formosae heroinae, i. e. Cassandra, Andromache, Helena, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:19:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 19, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. herois.</sense></entryFree>
heroion: <entryFree id="n20573" type="greek" key="he_ro_i_on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hērōīon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(rw/eion</foreign>, v. l. for heroum; v. 2. herous <sense id="n20573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
herois: <entryFree id="n20574" type="greek" key="he_ro_is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hērōis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(rwi+/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a demi-goddess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heroine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">heroidum ac dearum personis effictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteres heroidas aequare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 4, 33</bibl></cit>.—In Gr., <hi rend="ital">dat. plur.</hi> heroisin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:5:43" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 5, 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20574.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hērōĭdes</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the title of the Epistles of Ovid</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 908</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
herophile: <entryFree id="n20575" type="main" key="He_ro^phi^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hērŏphĭlē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(hrofi/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n20575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a priestess of Apollo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:68" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
heros: <entryFree id="n20576" type="greek" key="he_ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hēros</orth>, <itype>ōis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(/rws</foreign>, <sense id="n20576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a demi-god</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hero.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20576.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">heroum veteres casus imitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:47:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 47, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille deum vitam accipiet divisque videbit Permixtos heroas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnanimi heroes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:649" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 649</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incipit Aeneas heros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 103</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also: Troius heros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 451</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Laertius heros,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Ulysses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:5:3" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem virum aut heroa lyra vel acri Tibia sumis celebrare, Clio?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ajax heros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intererit multum, divusne loquatur an heros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 114</bibl></cit>.—<pos>Adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a hero</hi> or <hi rend="ital">heroes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heroic</hi>: ecce modo heroas sensus efferre videmus Nugari solitos Graece (for heroicos or heroos), <hi rend="ital">heroic thoughts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">deeds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:69" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 69</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20576.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in Cicero of illustrious men: heros ille noster <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, Cic. Att. 1, 17, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antonii colloquium cum heroibus nostris (i. e. Bruto et Cassio),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illorum fuit heroum (i. e. Platonis et Aristotelis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and ironically of Clodius: ignari, quantum in illo heroe esset animi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
herostratus: <entryFree id="n20577" type="main" key="He_rostra^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hērostrătus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(hro/stratos</foreign>, <sense id="n20577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the notorious Ephesian who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in order to make himself famous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set fire to the temple of Diana at Ephesus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 40, 3</bibl>. <cb n="HESP" /></sense></entryFree>
herous: <entryFree id="n20578" type="main" key="He_ro_us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hērōus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n20578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of Hero;</hi> v. Hero, I. B.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n20579" type="greek" key="he_ro_us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hērōus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(rw|os</foreign>, <sense id="n20579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to a hero</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heroic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20579.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:7:2" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chelys,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 102</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 3</bibl> (4, 2), 16: versus, <hi rend="ital">heroic</hi> or <hi rend="ital">epic verse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:27:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 27, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 28</bibl>: pes, <hi rend="ital">an heroic</hi> or <hi rend="ital">epic foot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:47:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 47, 182</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20579.2" n="II" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20579.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">hērōus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an epic verse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apte Jungitur herous cum breviore modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:17:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 17, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:20:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 20, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in herois,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:88" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 88</bibl></cit> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> also: <cit><quote lang="la">herous, qui est idem dactylus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:88" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 89</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20579.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">hērōum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n20579.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A monument to the memory of a hero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 5, 6, § 18</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n20579.6" n="2" level="3"> = asphodelus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 32, § 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
herpes: <entryFree id="n20580" type="greek" key="herpes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">herpes</orth>, <itype>ētis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(/rphs</foreign>. <sense id="n20580.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cutaneous eruption that creeps and spreads</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 14, 87, § 145</bibl>; and perh. Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 117, 22</bibl>, where others read herpestica (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 3</bibl>, written as Greek).—</sense><sense id="n20580.1" n="II" level="1"> Herpes quoque animal a Graecis vocatur, quo praecipue sanantur quaecumque serpunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 13, 39, § 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
herpesticus: <entryFree id="n20581" type="greek" key="herpesti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">herpestĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(rphstiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spreading</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eating</hi>: gangraena, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 117, 22</bibl> (al. herpes ita; v. herpes, I.).</sense></entryFree>
herpyllum: <entryFree id="n20582" type="greek" key="herpyllum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">herpyllum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(/rpullon</foreign>, <sense id="n20582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a climbing evergreen plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> sisymbrium, <hi rend="ital">creeping thyme</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 105</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called herpyllus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
herse: <entryFree id="n20583" type="main" key="Herse_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hersē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(/ersh</foreign>, <sense id="n20583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a daughter of Cecrops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beloved by Mercury</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 559</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">724</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
hersilia: <entryFree id="n20584" type="main" key="Hersi^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hersĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wife of Romulus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:830 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 830 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hertha: <entryFree id="n20585" type="main" key="Hertha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hertha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Nerthus.</entryFree>
heruli: <entryFree id="n20586" type="main" key="He^ru^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕrŭli</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrŭli</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Herulians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the people of Northern Germany who penetrated into Italy and dissolved the western Roman Empire</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Diac. Longob. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Mamert. Pan. ad Maxim. 5</bibl>; Genethl. 7.—In <number>sing.</number> collect.: <cit><quote lang="la">cursu Herulus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 7, 236</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
herus: <entryFree id="n20587" type="main" key="he^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕrus</orth>, v. erus.</entryFree>
hervum: <entryFree id="n20588" type="main" key="hervum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hervum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. ervum.</entryFree>
hesiodus: <entryFree id="n20589" type="main" key="He_si^o^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēsĭŏdus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(hsi/odos</foreign>, <sense id="n20589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Greek poet Hesiod</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:21:3" default="NO">17, 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:19" default="NO">5, 11, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:14:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 14, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 15, 98</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20589.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n20589.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēsĭŏdēus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-īus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(hsio/deios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to Hesiod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hesiodic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud Hesiodium laudatur a doctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:4:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 213</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n20589.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēsĭŏdĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 2, 176</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hesione: <entryFree id="n20590" type="main" key="He_si^o^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēsĭŏnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēsĭŏna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(hsio/nh</foreign>. <sense id="n20590.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of Laomedon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Troy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whom Hercules rescued from a seamonster and gave in marriage to Telamon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to whom she bore Teucer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:211 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 211 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 157</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 31" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:89" default="NO">89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:97" default="NO">97</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20590.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The title of a tragedy of Nœvius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=107" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 107</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hesperia: <entryFree id="n20591" type="main" key="Hespe^ria"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hespĕria</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. Hesperus, II. A. 2.</entryFree>
hesperides: <entryFree id="n20592" type="main" key="Hespe^ri^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hespĕrĭdes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. Hesperus, II. B. 2. b.</entryFree>
hesperie: <entryFree id="n20593" type="main" key="Hespe^ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hespĕrĭē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(esperi/h</foreign>, <sense id="n20593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a daughter of the river Cebren</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was killed by the bite of a snake</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:769" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 769</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hesperis: <entryFree id="n20594" type="main" key="Hespe^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hespĕris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, v. Hesperus, II. B.</entryFree>
hesperius: <entryFree id="n20595" type="main" key="Hespe^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hespĕrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Hesperus, II. A.</entryFree>
hesperugo: <entryFree id="n20596" type="hapax" key="hespe^ru_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hespĕrūgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Hesperus</etym>, <sense id="n20596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the evening star</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 877" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 877</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hesperus: <entryFree id="n20597" type="greek" key="Hespe^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hespĕrus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(/esperos</foreign> (the evening; pure Lat., with the digamma, vesper; hence transf.), <sense id="n20597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the evening star</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hesperus;</hi> acc. to the myth, <hi rend="ital">the son of Cephalus and Aurora;</hi> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:42" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 42</bibl>; or, acc. to another myth, <hi rend="ital">the son of Iapetus and Asia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and brother of Atlas;</hi> cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 530</bibl>, and 4, 484: infima est quinque errantium terraeque proxima stella Veneris, quae <foreign lang="greek">fwsfo/ros</foreign> Graece, Latine dicitur Lucifer, cum antegreditur solem, cum subsequitur autem Hesperos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam non veniens Aurora Cessantem vidit, non Hesperus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 441</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:314" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 314</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:419" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 419</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ite domum saturae, venit Hesperus, ite capellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 77</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20597.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n20597.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hespĕrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">situated towards the west</hi>, <hi rend="ital">western</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hesperian.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20597.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: Hesperium <cb n="HETT" /> fretum, <hi rend="ital">the western ocean</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 258</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:142" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">axis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 214</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">constitit Hesperio, regnis Atlantis, in orbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:628" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 628</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperi Porrecta majestas ad ortus Solis ab Hesperio cubili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 16</bibl></cit>: rex, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Atlas</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Hesperus</hi>, Ov. de Nuce, 111: <cit><quote lang="la">Hesperios amnes, Rhenum Rhodanumque Padumque, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>western</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 258</bibl></cit>: et terram Hesperiam venies, <hi rend="ital">the land of the west</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Italy</hi> (because situated to the west of the Trojans), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:781" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 781</bibl>; cf. in the foll. 2.; so of <hi rend="ital">Italy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 601</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 703</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n20597.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hespĕria</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. terra), <hi rend="ital">the land of the west</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hesperia;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Italy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Spain</hi>: est locus, Hesperiam quam mortales perhibebant, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 23 Vahl.); <cit><quote lang="la">imitated by Vergil: est locus, Hesperiam Grai cognomine dicunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 530</bibl></cit>; so of <hi rend="ital">Italy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 5, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:224 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 224 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nunc Hesperia sospes ab ultima, etc.,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Spain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 36, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20597.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hespĕris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">of evening</hi> or <hi rend="ital">the west</hi>, <hi rend="ital">western</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hesperian.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20597.6" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: corniger Hesperidum fluvius regnator aquarum (Tibris), i. e. <hi rend="ital">Italian</hi> (cf. above), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 77</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n20597.7" n="2" level="3"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n20597.8" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hespĕris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the queen's gilliflower</hi>, Hesperis tristis, Linn.: <cit><quote lang="la">hesperis noctu magis olet, inde nomine invento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 7, 18, § 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20597.9" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">He-spĕrĭdes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n20597.10" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The Hesperides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughters of Hesperus</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">of Erebus and Nox</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on an island beyond Mount Atlas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watched a garden with golden apples</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:17:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 17, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 1, 3</bibl>; Hyg. Fab. praef.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hesperidum mala, poma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:158" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 158</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hesperidum serpens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:114" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 114</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20597.11" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A group of islands in the Atlantic Ocean</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:10:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 10, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also: Hesperidum insulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 31, 36, § 201</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hesternus: <entryFree id="n20598" type="main" key="hesternus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hesternus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hes, whence heri, analog. with hodiernus</etym>, <sense id="n20598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of yesterday</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yesterday's</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputatio hesterni et hodierni diei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:21:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 21, 81</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hesterno die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:29:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 29, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hesterno sermone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: nocte <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermone,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquiae,</quote> <trans><tr>of yesterday</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:6:3:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 6, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:44" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">minutal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fercula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 78</bibl></cit>: ex potatione, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:66" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 66</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Iaccho (i. e. vino),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corollae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 34</bibl></cit> (3, 32), 59: <cit><quote lang="la">crines,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>not yet arranged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:15:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 15, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">coma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lar,</quote> <trans><tr>to whom sacrifice was made yesterday</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:542" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 542</bibl></cit> Serv.: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes suscitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:643" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 643</bibl></cit>.—Facete: Quirites, <hi rend="ital">Romans of yesterday</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">slaves recently made free</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:106" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 106</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hesternorum immemores, acta pueritiae recordari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—In the <case>abl.</case> adverb., hesterno (sc. die), <hi rend="ital">yesterday</hi>, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 180</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 74, 1</bibl>; Sulpic. Sev. Dial. 3, 1, 1; 3, 5, 1.</sense></entryFree>
hestiaeotis: <entryFree id="n20599" type="main" key="Hesti^aeo_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hestĭaeōtis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(estiaiw=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n20599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district in Thessaly between Olympus and Ossa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 9, § 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hesus: <entryFree id="n20600" type="main" key="Hesus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hesus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Esus.</entryFree>
hetaeria: <entryFree id="n20601" type="greek" key="he^taeri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕtaerĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(tairi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n20601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> (religious) <hi rend="ital">brotherhood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fraternity</hi>, Traj. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:43:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 43, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 10:97:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 97, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hetaerice: <entryFree id="n20602" type="greek" key="he^taeri^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕtaerĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(tairikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n20602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a body of horse-guards in the Macedonian army</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
heteroclitus: <entryFree id="n20603" type="greek" key="he^te^ro_^cli^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕtĕrō^clĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(tero/klitos</foreign>, in gram. lang., <sense id="n20603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">varying in declension</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heteroclite</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 23</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1065</bibl> ib.</sense></entryFree>
heterocranea: <entryFree id="n20604" type="greek" key="he^te^rocra_ne^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕtĕrocrānĕa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(terokrani/a</foreign>, <sense id="n20604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">headache on one side of the head</hi>, also called hemicrania, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 9, 45, § 99</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hetriculum: <entryFree id="n20605" type="main" key="Hetricu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hetricŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n20605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of the Bruttii</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:19:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 19, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hetruria: <entryFree id="n20606" type="main" key="Hetru_ria"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hetrūria</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hetruscus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Etruria.</entryFree>
hetta: <entryFree id="n20607" type="gloss" key="hetta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hetta</orth> <itype>res minimi pretii, quasi hieta</itype>, id est hiatus hominis atque oscitatio. Alii pusulam dixerunt esse, quae in coquendo pane solet assurgere, a qua accipi rem nullius pretii, cum dicimus: Non hettae te facio,<pb n="851" /> <cb n="HEXA" />  Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=99" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 99</bibl> Müll. <sense id="n20607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> [perhaps kindred with the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">h(/ttwn, h(/sswn</foreign>, less, meaner; cf. the foll. art.].</sense></entryFree>
hettematicus: <entryFree id="n20608" type="greek" key="hette_ma^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hettēmătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(tthmatiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">poor of its kind</hi>, Firm. Math. 3, 9.</sense></entryFree>
heu: <entryFree id="n20609" type="main" key="heu!"><orth extent="full" lang="la">heu!</orth> <pos>interj.</pos> (constr. <sense id="n20609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> or with <case>acc.</case>, rarely with <case>nom.</case> or <hi rend="ital">voc.;</hi> cf. Huschke ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:28" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 6, 28</bibl>; Forbig. and Wagn. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 274</bibl>. The passages cited for heu mihi, etc., Hand, Turs. III. 68 sq., are mostly corrected in recent edd.) </sense><sense id="n20609.1" n="I" level="1"> An exclamation of grief or pain, <hi rend="ital">oh! ah! alas!</hi> heu heu, quam ego malis perdidi modis, quod tibi detuli et quod dedi! <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quatenus, heu nefas! Virtutem incolumem odimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">palam captis gravis, heu nefas heu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: o domus antiqua, heu quam dispari Dominare domino! Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:139" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 39, 139</bibl> (Trag. Rel. R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> p. 224</bibl>): heu, mea fortuna, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 90, 14</bibl> (Trag. v. 408 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">heu, hercle, mulier, multum et audax et mala's,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu, nimis longo satiate ludo (Mars)!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: heu me miseram! interii, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 504, 6</bibl> (Trag. v. 228 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 2, 29</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">heu me miserum!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 9, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 22</bibl>; Afran. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:20:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 20, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu me infelicem!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; Turp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:35:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 35, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu edepol hominem nihili!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 3, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu edepol res turbulentas!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epid. 1, 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu hercle hominem multum et odiosum mihi!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu hercle odiosas res!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 119</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu me, per urbem Fabula quanta fui!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:7" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu, cor meum finditur!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu edepol, patrem eum miserum praedicas!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illuc heu miseri traducimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:159" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu, edepol ne ego homo vivo miser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:Men. 5:5:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu, nunc misero mihi demum exsilium infelix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:849" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 849</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20609.2" n="II" level="1"> In a few doubtful passages in Plautus as an exclamation of admiration or surprise, <hi rend="ital">oh!</hi> heu hercle mortalem catum! <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 147</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">heu edepol mortalis malos!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 26</bibl></cit>.‡ † <orth extent="full" lang="la">Heurēsis</orth>, <itype>ĕos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu(/rhsis</foreign> (a finding out), <hi rend="ital">a Roman festival in November</hi>, Calend. Farnes. ap. Orell. Inscr. II. p. 381.</sense></entryFree>
heureta: <entryFree id="n20610" type="greek" key="heure^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">heurĕta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu(reth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inventor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inventive person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
heus: <entryFree id="n20611" type="main" key="heus!"><orth extent="full" lang="la">heus!</orth> <pos>interj.</pos> Used in calling attention, <sense id="n20611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ho! ho there! hark! holloa!</hi> heus, reclude: <cit><quote lang="la">heus, Tranio, etiamne aperis? ... heus vos, pueri, quid istic agitis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:28 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 28 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Syre, Syre inquam, heus, heus Syre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 107</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">heus, heus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 4, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">heus, Phaedrome, exi, exi, exi, inquam ocius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">heus, Staphyla, prodi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heus, Strobile, sequere propere me,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heus, ecquis hic est?</quote> <trans><tr>holloa there</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Amph. 4, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 2, 19</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">heus, ubi estis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heus, audin' quid ait?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et heus, jube illos illinc amabo abscedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heus age, responde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:17" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heus bone, tu palles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heus, etiam mensas consumimus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heus tu, te volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">heus tu, Rufio, cave sis mentiaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:22:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 22, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heus tu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">heus vos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Casin. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 2, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 63</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Atque heus tu. <hi rend="ital">Ni.</hi> Quid vis? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 93</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Sed heus tu. <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Quid vis? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed heus tu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 11, 2</bibl>.—Heus always begins a clause, except sometimes in Terence: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium rerum heus necessitudo est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hexachordos: <entryFree id="n20612" type="greek" key="hexa^chordos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hexăchordos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(ca/xordos</foreign>, <sense id="n20612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having six musical strings</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stops</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">machina,</quote> <trans><tr>a water - organ with six stops</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hexaclinon: <entryFree id="n20613" type="greek" key="hexacli_non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hexaclīnon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(ca/klinon</foreign>, <sense id="n20613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a couch to hold six persons</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:60:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 60, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hexaemeron: <entryFree id="n20614" type="greek" key="Hexa^e_me^ron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hexăēmĕron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ecah/meron</foreign> (<sense id="n20614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in six days</hi>), <hi rend="ital">the six days of the creation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 6, 42</bibl>; also <hi rend="ital">the title of a work on the creation of the world</hi>, by Ambrosius; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 6, 42</bibl>. <cb n="HIAT" /></sense></entryFree>
hexagonum: <entryFree id="n20615" type="greek" key="hexa^go_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hexăgōnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(ca/gwnon</foreign>, <sense id="n20615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a six-sided figure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hexagon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 2, 10</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 5</bibl> written as Greek); also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">hexăgōnium</orth>, Ambros. Hexaēm. 5, 21, 69.</sense></entryFree>
hexameter: <entryFree id="n20616" type="greek" key="hexa^me^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hexămĕter</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">hexămetrus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2430" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> p. 2430</bibl> P.), <itype>tri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(ca/metros</foreign> (of six measures), with or without versus, <sense id="n20616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a verse consisting of six feet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hexameter</hi>: versus, Lucil. ap. Porphyr. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 87</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">metrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 1, 38, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antipater ille Sidonius solitus est versus hexametros aliosque variis modis atque numeris fundere ex tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:50:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 50, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hexametrorum instar versuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:66:222" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 66, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber scriptus ab eo hexametris versibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:85" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in longis versibus qui hexametri dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:15:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 15, 1</bibl></cit> (cf.
