Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:27:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 27, 68</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">initium hexametri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:78" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 78</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">§ 74: finis hexametri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2441" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> p. 2441</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iambicus,</quote> <trans><tr>whose sixth foot is an iambus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 516</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
hexaphoros: <entryFree id="n20617" type="greek" key="hexa^pho^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hexăphŏros</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(cafo/ros</foreign>, <sense id="n20617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of six who carry a load together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">phalangarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n20617.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Borne by six together; subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hexăphŏrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(ca/foron</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a litter borne by six men</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:81:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 81, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non debes ferri mortuus hexaphoro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:77:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 77, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hexaptota: <entryFree id="n20618" type="greek" key="hexapto_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hexaptōta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. nomina), = <foreign lang="greek">e(ca/ptwta</foreign>, in gram., <sense id="n20618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nouns that have six cases</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 673</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 1, 6, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hexapylon: <entryFree id="n20619" type="main" key="Hexa^py^lon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hexăpylon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(eca/pulon</foreign>, <sense id="n20619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gate in Syracuse with six entrances</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32" default="NO" valid="yes">32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39" default="NO" valid="yes">39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hexas: <entryFree id="n20620" type="greek" key="hexas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hexas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(ca/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the number six</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 108 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
hexastichus: <entryFree id="n20621" type="greek" key="hexasti^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hexastĭchus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(ca/stixos</foreign>, <sense id="n20621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of six lines</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rows</hi>: hordeum, perh. our <hi rend="ital">long-eared barley</hi>, Hordeum caeleste, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">myrtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 29, 37, § 122</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hexastylos: <entryFree id="n20622" type="greek" key="hexasty^los"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hexastylos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(ca/stulos</foreign>, <sense id="n20622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having six columns</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 2, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hexecontalithos: <entryFree id="n20623" type="greek" key="hexe_conta^li^thos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hexēcontălĭthos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(chkonta/liqos</foreign> (sixty-colored stone), <sense id="n20623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 60, § 167</bibl>; Solin. 31.</sense></entryFree>
hexeris: <entryFree id="n20624" type="greek" key="hexe_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hexēris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(ch/rhs</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">nau=s</foreign>), <sense id="n20624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vessel with six banks of oars</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 23, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 9, 8</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> hexere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8</bibl>, ext. 11.</sense></entryFree>
hiantia: <entryFree id="n20625" type="hapax" key="hi^anti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>hio</etym>, <sense id="n20625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an opening</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hiasco: <entryFree id="n20626" type="main" key="hi^asco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭasco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n20626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break open</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi primum nuces pineae incipiunt hiascere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 17, 2</bibl></cit>; Gargil. de Re Hort. 2, 1.</sense></entryFree>
hiaspis: <entryFree id="n20627" type="main" key="hi^aspis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭaspis</orth>, v. iaspis.</entryFree>
hiatus: <entryFree id="n20628" type="main" key="hi^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an opening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aperture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleft</hi> (class. in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>; cf. rima, rictus). </sense><sense id="n20628.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalia cibum partim oris hiatu et dentibus ipsis capessunt, partim unguium tenacitate arripiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 680</bibl>.—Without oris: <cit><quote lang="la">ne immodicus hiatus rictum distendat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremus exspirantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nemeaeus magnus hiatus Ille leonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quinquaginta atris immanis hiatibus Hydra,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>open mouths</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:576" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 576</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:557" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 557</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:34" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">personae pallentis hiatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:175" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno sublimis pardus hiatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 123</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 7, § 38</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of Boreas: imbres, sicco quos asper hiatu Persolidat Boreas,</quote> <trans><tr>with a dry throat</tr>, <tr>dry breath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:352" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 352</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repentini terrarum hiatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hauriri urbes terrae hiatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 119</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Gyges) descendit in illum hiatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:9:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 9, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neu distracta (Natura) suum late dispandat hiatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:599" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 599</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum caeli patet altus hiatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 418</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 375</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fit et caeli ipsius hiatus, quod vocant chasma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 26, 26, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corticis bipedalis hiatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 12, 23, § 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiatus patuli fontis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>basin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">specus est tenebroso caecus hiatu,</quote> <trans><tr>aperture</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:409" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 409</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteris rimae cum texit hiatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:195" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 195</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid dignum tanto feret hic promissor hiatu?</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of such pompous language</tr>, <tr>high-flown style</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 138</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:636" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 636</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20628.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20628.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">an eager desire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">longing</hi> (so used by Tac.): <cit><quote lang="la">libidine sanguinis et hiatu praemiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20628.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in gram., <hi rend="ital">a hiatus</hi>: habet enim ille tamquam hiatus concursu vocalium molle quiddam et quod indicet non ingratam <cb n="HIBE" /> negligentiam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:23:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 23, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Catullus) amans hiatus illius Homerici suavitatem, ebriosa dixit propter insequentis a litterae (verbi acinae) concentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:20:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 20, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hiber: <entryFree id="n20629" type="main" key="Hi^ber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭber</orth>, v. Hiberes.</entryFree>
hiberes: <entryFree id="n20630" type="main" key="Hi^be_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭbēres</orth> (less correctly, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ibēres</orth>), <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/ibhres</foreign>. <sense id="n20630.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Iberians</hi>, the Greek name for <hi rend="ital">Spaniards</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 9, 6</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number> collect.: <cit><quote lang="la">me peritus Discet Hiber Rhodanique potor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:20:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 20, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">durus Iber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 258</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n20630.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭbērus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Ib-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Iberians</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Spaniards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Iberian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Spanish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gurges,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Western Ocean</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:913" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 913</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 324</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">minium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:3:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscis, i. e. scomber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Geryon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 184</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vaccae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Geryon's</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:519" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 519</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lorica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:29:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 29, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">nodi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:266" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 266</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20630.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭbērus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Ib-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, =<foreign lang="greek">*)/ibhros</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the river Iberus in Spain</hi>, now the <hi rend="ital">Ebro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:111" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 20, 34, § 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes">5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20630.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭ-bēri</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Ib-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = Hiberes, <hi rend="ital">the Iberians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Spaniards</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 408</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20630.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭ-bērĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Ib-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ibhri/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Iberia</hi>, the Greek name of <hi rend="ital">Spain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 14, 50</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20630.5" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭbērĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Ib-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Iberic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Spanish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <trans><tr>on the eastern side of Spain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 2, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:110" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 20, 34, § 110</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 23, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:4:3" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20630.6" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭbērĭăcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Ib-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Iberic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Spanish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:510" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 510</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20630.7" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭbē-rīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female Iberian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Spanish woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:53" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 53</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20630.8" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Asiatic people near Mount Caucasus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neighbors of the Colchians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in modern Georgia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:5:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 5, 6</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number> collect.: <cit><quote lang="la">Armeniae praetentus Hiber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:166" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 166</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:750" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 750</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭbērĭ</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:21" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5, 21</bibl>.—And <number>sing.</number>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭbērus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an Iberian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:235" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 235</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭbērĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Ib-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of Iberia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the Caucasus</hi> (now <hi rend="ital">Georgia</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 4, 4, § 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 10, 11, § 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 13, 15, § 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:21" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:120" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hiberna: <entryFree id="n20631" type="main" key="hi_berna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hīberna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. hibernus, II. B.</entryFree>
hibernaculum: <entryFree id="n20632" type="main" key="hi_berna_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hībernācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>hiberno</etym>, <sense id="n20632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a winter residence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winter apartment.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20632.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20632.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in milit. lang., <orth extent="full" lang="la">hī-bernācŭla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">tents for winterquarters</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an encampment for winter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winter tents</hi> (opp. hiberna, winter-quarters in gen.): <cit><quote lang="la">hibernacula Carthaginiensium lignea ferme tota erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hibernacula etiam, res nova militi Romano, aedificari coepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; 22, 32, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 8, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hibernalis: <entryFree id="n20633" type="main" key="hi_berna_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hībernālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hibernus</etym>, <sense id="n20633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wintry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winter-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">glacies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:16:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 16, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hibernia: <entryFree id="n20634" type="main" key="Hi^berni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭbernĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (= <foreign lang="greek">*)iouerni/a</foreign> Ptol.), <sense id="n20634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the island now called Ireland</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 16, 30, § 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 24</bibl>.— Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Iverna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:6:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 6, 6</bibl>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ju-verna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:160" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 160</bibl>; and (acc. to the Gr. form <foreign lang="greek">*)ie/rnh</foreign> Strab.) <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ierna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, App. de Mundo, p. 60; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Iernē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 251</bibl>; IV. Cons. Hon. 33.</sense></entryFree>
hiberno: <entryFree id="n20635" type="main" key="hi_berno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hīberno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>hibernus</etym>, <sense id="n20635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pass the winter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to winter.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20635.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">furcillas reducit hibernatum in tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:8:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(thynni) ubicumque deprehensi usque ad aequinoctium, ibi hibernant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 20, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum in agrum Vescinum hibernatum duxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:46:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 46, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novas (naves) Panormi subducit, ut in sicco hibernarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 1, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20635.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to keep in winter-quarters</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam vero quemadmodum milites hibernent, quotidie sermones ac litterae perferuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 13, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:46" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 1</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n20635.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., <hi rend="ital">to rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repose</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:7" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hibernus: <entryFree id="n20636" type="main" key="hi_bernus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hībernus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root Sanscr. himas, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xiw/n</foreign>, snow, v. hiems; for hiemernus (hīm-), cf. <foreign lang="greek">xeimerino/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n20636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to winter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wintry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winter</hi>-. </sense><sense id="n20636.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiberno tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:699" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 699</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:940" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 940</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in aprico maxime pratuli loco, quod erat hibernum tempus anni, considerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporibus hibernis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:10:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 10, § 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">menses,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>winter-time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:29" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exortus solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:17:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 21</bibl></cit>. § <cit><quote lang="la">57: occasus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 5</bibl></cit>, <pb n="852" /> <cb n="HIC" /> 5, § <cit><quote lang="la">34: navigatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 14, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 158</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">nix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubiculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:1:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunica,</quote> <trans><tr>winter dress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 94</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">calceatus feminarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 8, 13, § 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 26, 43, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 47, 72, § 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpes,</quote> <trans><tr>wintry</tr>, <tr>cold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 41</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Caucasus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:612" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 612</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and transf. Borysthenidae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>inhabiting a cold country</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:7:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cori,</quote> <trans><tr>stormy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 15, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neptunus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 355</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvis,</quote> <trans><tr>a dry winter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 101</bibl></cit>; quoted in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 2, 2, § 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lycia,</quote> <trans><tr>cold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones,</quote> <trans><tr>lying in winter-quarters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumulus vergens in occidentem hibernum,</quote> <trans><tr>to the south-west</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:46:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 46, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20636.2" n="b" level="4"> In <hi rend="ital">neut.</hi> adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">increpui (sc. Arcturus) hibernum, et fluctus movi maritimos,</quote> <trans><tr>stormily</tr>, <tr>tempestuously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 69</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n20636.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hībernum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the winter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiberno,</quote> <trans><tr>in the winter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20636.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">hīberna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. castra), <hi rend="ital">winter-quarters</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres (legiones), quae circum Aquileiam hiemabant, ex hibernis educit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hiberna in Sequanos exercitum deduxit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 54</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 2, 35, 3; 3, 2, 1; 3, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 38, 4 et saep.: quo (tempore) neque frumenta in hibernis erant neque multum a maturitate aberant,</quote> <trans><tr>in the winter camp</tr>, <tr>winter magazines</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:48:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 48, 5</bibl></cit> Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consules hiberna egerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiberna aedificavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:48:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 48, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 38, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20636.5" n="2" level="3"> (Sc. loca.) <hi rend="ital">The range of cattle in winter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:67" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 67</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20636.6" n="3" level="3"> (Sc. tempora.) <hi rend="ital">Winters</hi> = years, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 266</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hiberus: <entryFree id="n20637" type="main" key="Hi^be_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭbērus</orth>, v. Iberus.</entryFree>
hibiscum: <entryFree id="n20638" type="greek" key="hi^biscum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭbiscum</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕbiscum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:80" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:82" default="NO">82</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭbiscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 2, 30</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i\bi/skos</foreign>, <sense id="n20638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the marsh-mallow</hi>, Althaea officinalis, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 4, 14, § 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:89" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 5, 27, § 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haedorumque gregem viridi compellere hibisco,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with a marsh-mallow twig</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hibrida: <entryFree id="n20639" type="main" key="hibri^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hibrĭda</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">hybrĭda</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ibr-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>most prob. kindred with <foreign lang="greek">u(bri/zw, u(/bris</foreign>, qs. unbridled, lawless, unnatural; hence</etym>, of animals produced from two different species, <sense id="n20639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mongrel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hybrid.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20639.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nullo genere aeque facilis mixtura cum fero (quam in suibus), qualiter natos antiqui hybridas vocabant ceu semiferos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 53, 79, § 213</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20639.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of persons, <hi rend="ital">one born of a Roman father and a foreign mother</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">of a freeman and a slave</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibique postea ex hybridis, libertinis servisque conscripserat, Auct. B. Afr. 19, 4: hybrida quo pacto sit Persius ultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:39:20" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 39, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:22" default="NO">8, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Varius propter obscurum jus civitatis Hibrida cognominatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:6:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hic: <entryFree id="n20640" type="main" key="hi_c"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hīc</orth>, <itype>haec, hōc</itype> (<sense id="n20640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> hujus, monosyl., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">96</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 115</bibl>; <case>dat.</case> huïc, Sidon. Carm. 7, 145; <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Descr. Orb. 22</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">dat. sing. fem.</hi> hae rei, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 14, 3</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> HONC for hunc, C. I. L. 1, 32; <hi rend="ital">nom. plur.</hi> hic, Enn. ap. Philarg. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 230</bibl> = Ann. v. 414 Vahl.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=73" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 73</bibl> Müll.; <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi> haec, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, B. <hi rend="ital">init.; dat.</hi> and <case>abl.</case> hibus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 20</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=78" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 78</bibl> Müll.; v. Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 203 sqq.), <hi rend="ital">pron. demonstr.</hi> [from the pronom. root <hi rend="ital">i</hi> (whence also comes <hi rend="ital">is</hi>), with the demonstr. suffix <hi rend="ital">ce</hi>] points to something near or present, or which is conceived of as present, <hi rend="ital">this.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20640.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic homo sanus non est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapidus fluvius est hic, non hac temere transiri potest ... apud hunc fluvium, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid praeclarum putet in rebus humanis, qui haec deorum regna perspexerit? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus hoc,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc avunculo, atque in hac tam clara re publica natus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum singuli saluti huic civitati fuerunt, et qui sunt procul ab aetatis hujus memoria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his libris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hae feriae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9</bibl></cit>; 1, 20; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc otio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec caelestia vel studiosissime solet quaerere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad haec cituma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:39:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 39, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20640.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (cf. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 520): <cit><quote lang="la">hic insidiantes vigilant, Enn. l. l.: hi domum me ad se auferent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 94</bibl></cit>: non mihi videtur, quod hi venerunt, alius nobis<cb n="HIC" />  sermo esse quaerendus, sed agendum accuratius, et dicendum dignum aliquid horum auribus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">feceris (ut etiam pro his dicam) nobis gratum omnibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 21</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ubi Amphitruo erus conspicatus est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">docere hoc poterat ille homines paene agrestes, et apud imperitos audebat haec dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixerat hoc ille, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec Scipio cum dixisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec plurimis a me verbis dicta sunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20640.3" n="B" level="2"> More emphatic, in the original full form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">hīce, haece</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">hōce</orth> (not, as formerly written, hicce, haecce, hocce; in <hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> HVIVSQVE; in <hi rend="ital">nom. plur.</hi> hisce, like ieis = ei, and ques = qui, see below; and apocopated in <hi rend="ital">nom. plur. fem.</hi> haec for haece, and in <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> horunc, harunc, for horunce, harunce); <cit><quote lang="la">and, with the interrogative particle, hicine, haecine, hocine (mostly ante - class.): hoce haud dubium est quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum hinc profugiens vendidit in Alide Patri hujusce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 10</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hujusce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 120</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 76</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">87</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">atque hujusce rei judicium jam continuo video futurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:14:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 14, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hisce homines ubi habitent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 36</bibl></cit>; v. Ritschl ad h. l.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hisce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 125</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. prol. 35</bibl> Fleck.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 1, 5</bibl> ib., and perh. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 24</bibl> (Ritschl, hice): hice, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 15, 29</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 122 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 117</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">haec sunt atque aliae multae in magnis dotibus Incommoditates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec (puellae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:11:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 11, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 34, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:601" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 601</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 305</bibl>; cf. Bentl. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 2, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliut posticum harunce aedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 41</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">harunc aedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine opera tua nihil di horunc facere possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horunc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedo signum, si harunc Baccharum es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harunc aedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hisce ego Placidum ted hodie reddam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid dicam hisce, incertus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu ab hisce rebus animum avoca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> in Cic. Fam. 4, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hisce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 7, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 81</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 4, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 71</bibl>; 4, 2, 35 et saep.: <hi rend="ital">Thr.</hi> Tu hosce instrue. <hi rend="ital">Gn</hi> Illuc est sapere! ut hosce instruxit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 11</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hosce,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud hasce aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 194</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hasce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 6, 17</bibl> et saep.— <cit><quote lang="la">With the interrog. particle: hicin' Achilles est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 61</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hicinest?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 49</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hicine vir patriae natus usquam nisi in patria morietur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:38:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 38, 104</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">haecine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 206</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huncine hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 68</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">huncine hominem! hancine impudentiam! judices, hanc audaciam!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:25:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 25, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hocine hic pacto potest Inhibere imperium magister?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o Juppiter, hoscine mores!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hacine victoria sola aut hac praeda contenti estis futuri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 17, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so in the shorter form, hicne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:48:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 48, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hocne equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hocne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hacne natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 62</bibl></cit>: haece locutus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 239 Vahl.) al.—So, Fortuna hujusce diei, as a particular deity, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:11:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 11, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 54</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in inscrr. also written HVIVSQVE DIEI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">HVIVSQ. LOCI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1580</bibl></cit>; 2300; <cit><quote lang="la">and HOIVSQVE AEDIS ERGO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2488</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20640.4" n="C" level="2"> With other pronouns: <cit><quote lang="la">hos eosdem motus perturbationes dixerimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum idem hoc visum diceretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc idem fit in reliquis civitatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:74:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 74, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec eadem centurionibus tribunisque militum mandabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec eadem genera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ipsum civile jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed hoc ipsum ex superiore pendet quaestione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:45" default="NO">8, 3, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hunc eum ipsum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit> Goer. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">idem hoc ipsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:9:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic illi legato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 22</bibl></cit>, <cb n="HIC" /> 52: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc illum fatis Portendi generum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 255</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hic est enim ille vultus semper idem, quem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:15:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 15, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic est ille status quantitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: haec est illa, quae <foreign lang="greek">dei/nwsis</foreign> vocatur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus istius facti stultitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista haec epigrammata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: hunc talem virum, Cic. fil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 21, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">callidum quendam hunc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:50:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 50, 218</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20640.5" n="D" level="2"> Opp. to ille, iste, less freq. to hic, alter, alius, etc., <hi rend="ital">this</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the latter</hi>, to indicate the nearer object (which is to be determined not so much by the phraseology as by the thought; so that hic may refer to that noun whose position in the sentence is the more remote, but which is the most closely connected with the speaker, and of the most importance to him, in which case it is to be rendered by <hi rend="ital">that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the former</hi>, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">ejusdem esse, qui in illa re peccarit, hoc quoque admisisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:16:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 16, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in his undis et tempestatibus ad summam senectutem maluit jactari, quam in illa tranquillitate atque otio jucundissime vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si deerunt haec remedia, ad illa declinandum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hic testamento, ille proximitate nitatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in his judicem sibi, in illis alii credere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec pars perorationis accusatori patronoque ex aequo communis est. Affectibus quoque iisdem fere utuntur: sed varius hic, ille saepius ac magis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:17" default="NO">17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tu ista caelestia de Scipione quaesieris, ego autem haec, quae videntur ante oculos, esse magis putem quaerenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iisdem enim hic sapiens, de quo loquor, oculis, quibus iste vester, caelum, terram, mare intuebitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 33, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si hoc loco scripsisset, isto verbo usus non esset, non isto loco verbum istud collocasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:41:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 41, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">has igitur tot sententias ut omittamus, haec nunc videamus, quae diu multumque defensa sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 42, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar facile diceret: Hic versus Plauti non est, hic est,</quote> <trans><tr>this ... that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego hoc dico. adversarius hoc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:4:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vendidit hic auro patriam ... Hic thalamum invasit natae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:621 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 621 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi molium objectus, hi proximas scaphas scandere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid responsuri sint adversarii his et his ... cum sciret haec et haec,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:3 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 3 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interim quaeritur: hoc an hoc? furtum an sacrilegium?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alter (Roscius) plurimarum palmarum vetus ac nobilis gladiator habetur, hic autem nuper se ad eum lanistam contulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occupat hic collem, cymbā sedet alter aduncā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 293</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20640.6" n="2" level="3"> Referring to that which in the speaker's mind is the nearer object, although by the position of the words it is the more remote: quam ob rem cave Catoni anteponas ne istum quidem ipsum, quem Apollo sapientissimum judicavit (i. e. Socratem): Hujus enim (i. e. Catonis, <hi rend="ital">of the former</hi>) facta, illius (i. e. Socratis) dicta laudantur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc posteriorem (artem) et Stoici et Peripatetici, priorem autem illi (i. e. Peripatetici) egregie tradiderunt, hi (i. e. Stoici) ne attigerunt quidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc Cicero atque Asinius certatim sunt usi: pro Scauro hic, ille pro filio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:10:1" default="NO">3, 10, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">melior tutiorque est certa pax quam sperata victoria: haec in tua, illa in deorum manu est,</quote> <trans><tr>the former ... the latter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:30:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 30, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quocumque aspicio, nihil est, nisi pontus et aër: Fluctibus hic tumidus, nubibus ille minax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:24" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 697</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20640.7" n="E" level="2"> In the <hi rend="ital">neutr. sing. subst.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid hoc hominist?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid hoc morbi est?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid hoc est negoti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 71</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 4, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc fructi pro labore ab his fero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edormiscam hoc villi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc commodi est, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:32:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 32, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc copiarum in Hispanias portatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 18, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc servitutis injunxisse, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc intervalli datum res tranquillas in urbe fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 25, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:39:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 39, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc solacii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 13, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc noctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">136</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20640.8" n="F" level="1"> Hoc with <hi rend="ital">verbs impers.</hi>, pleonast. as a subject (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">eamus, Amphitruo: lucescit hoc jam,</quote> <trans><tr>there is daybreak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 45</bibl></cit>: luciscit hoc jam, <pb n="853" /> <cb n="HIC" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucet hoc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 63</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20640.9" n="G" level="1"> Pregn. (qs. pointing to something with the finger), <hi rend="ital">this</hi>, <hi rend="ital">this ... here</hi> (ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>); most freq. of the speaker himself, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o(/de</foreign>, for ego: <cit><quote lang="la">hic homost omnium hominum praecipuos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic si quid nobis forte adversi evenerit, tibi erunt parata verba, huic homini verbera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 115</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">huic homini, i. q. mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic homo, i. q. ego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc hominem, i. q. me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 47</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vin' tu huic seni auscultare?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 7, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 2, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:7" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 6, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec res,</quote> <trans><tr>my property</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc in collum,</quote> <trans><tr>my neck</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 6, 9</bibl></cit> Brix (Ritschl, huc): ni haec praesensisset canes, <hi rend="ital">this dog</hi>, = ego, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 135</bibl> Brix ad loc.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr. absol.</hi>: tu quod te posterius purges hanc injuriam mihi nolle Factam esse, hujus non faciam, <hi rend="ital">not so much</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">not the least</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20640.10" n="H" level="1"> With reference to time, <hi rend="ital">of this time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now present</hi>, <hi rend="ital">actual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">this</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cena hac annonā est sine sacris hereditas,</quote> <trans><tr>in the present scarcity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed nondum haec, quae nunc tenet saeculum, neglegentia deum venerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his temporibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:77:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 77, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Cato, hujus nostri Catonis pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:16:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 16, 66</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si potius ad antiquorum diligentiam, quam ad horum luxuriam dirigas aedificationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:13:6 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 13, 6 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etenim qui haec vituperare volunt, Chrysogonum tantum posse queruntur,</quote> <trans><tr>the present times</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:48:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 48, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne horum quidem magnificentia operum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 55 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">very rarely of time just ended: ante hos annos quadraginta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante hos sex menses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante hoc triduum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 2, 5 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 270:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 270, 3</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n20640.11" n="II" level="1"> Very freq. referring to a thought that follows, and which may be expressed by a relative sentence, or by a sentence denoting the object, cause, or effect; with <hi rend="ital">qui</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quae</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>, an <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, etc. (more clearly indicative than the determinative, is, ea, id; though freq. confounded with it in MSS. and editt.). </sense><sense id="n20640.12" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">relat. clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Qui hodie fuerim liber, eum nunc potivit pater Servitutis: hic, qui verna natust, conqueritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eos, qui, etc.... his, qui, etc.... longe duco esse anteponendos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque his contentus sum, quae de ista consultatione scripta nobis summi ex Graecia homines reliquerunt, neque ea, quae mihi videntur, anteferre illis audeo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est tibi his solis utendum existimationibus ac judiciis, qui nunc sunt, hominum, sed iis etiam, qui futuri sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:15:section=43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 15, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis hic est homo, quem ante aedis video hoc noctis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde in laboribus et periculis fortitudo? nempe ab his, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec quae sunt in hoc genere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundus hic totus, quod domicilium di nobis dederunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc autem sphaerae genus, in quo, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 16: in his libris, quos legistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:9:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 9, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam quisque norit artem, in hac se exerceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:18:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 18, 41</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">lepide ipsi hi sunt capti, suis qui filiis fecere insidias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 90</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:40:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 40, 113</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi, qui, cum culpa carint, tamen malum Metuont, hi solent esse eris utibiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:2 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 2 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Bruti amore etsi mihi nihil novi adfers: tamen hoc audio libentius, quo saepius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">is porro, quo generosior celsiorque est, hoc majoribus velut organis commovetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc primum videamus, quidnam sit, de altero sole quod nuntiatum est in senatu, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mire tractat hoc Cicero pro Milone quae facturus fuerit Clodius, si praeturam invasisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20640.13" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat tunc haec nova et ignota ratio, solem lunae oppositum solere deficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed hoc vir excellenti providentia sensit ac vidit, non esse opportunissimos situs maritimos urbibus iis, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc tantum admiror, Flavum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:22" default="NO">11, 1, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum hoc definio, tantam esse necessitatem virtutis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: hoc simul accipe dictum: Quorum<cb n="HIC" />  ..., Eorundem libertati me parcere certum est, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl> (Ann. v. 204 Vahl.); cf. <cit><quote lang="la">with appositive clause: sic hoc proloquar: Principio, ut illo advenimus, Continuo Amphitruo delegit viros, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hoc: Non debes alienam uxorem optare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:32" default="NO">9, 2, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20640.14" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quod</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime hoc mihi mirum videri solet, quod, qui tranquillo mari gubernare se negent posse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaesierat ex me Scipio, quidnam sentirem de hoc, quod duo soles visos esse constaret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter hoc ipsum ostendenda non sunt, quod apparent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri primo integris viribus fortiter repugnare ... sed hoc superari, quod diuturnitate pugnae, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>in this that</tr>, <tr>herein that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ipso fidem detrahimus illis, quod sint tam gravia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ipso, quod,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:41" default="NO">5, 11, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:16" default="NO">6, 2, 16</bibl> et saep.: consilio vestro utar libenter, et hoc libentius, quod, etc., Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 8</bibl>, C, 1; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">id hoc facilius eis persuasit, quod undique loci natura Helvetii continentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc esse miseriorem gravioremque fortunam Sequanorum quam reliquorum, quod soli, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 32, 4</bibl></cit>;
