<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc magis, quod (al. quia) illic ut litigatores loquimur frequentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc sese excruciat animi, Quia leno ademit cistulam ei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod hoc etiam mirabilius debet videri, quia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 3, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc sunt exempla potentiora, quia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20640.15" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc hoc me orare a vobis jussit Juppiter, ut conquistores, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 64</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc quoque etiam mihi in mandatis dedit, Ut conquistores, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque hoc evenit In labore atque in dolore, ut mors obrepat interim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec enim hoc suscepi, ut, etc. ... neque hoc polliceor me facturum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim hac nos patria lege genuit aut educavit, ut ... sed ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: homines sunt hac lege generati, qui tuerentur, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare hoc animo in nos esse debebis, ut aetas nostra, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:5:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 5, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimum in hoc laboris exhausimus, ut ostenderemus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8 praef.</bibl></cit> § 6; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">habenda fides est vel in hoc, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 51</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc, ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:29" default="NO">10, 3, 29</bibl>: hoc erit tibi argumentum semper in promptu situm: Ne quid exspectes amicos, quod tute agere possies, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (Sat. v. 37 Vahl.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc scilicet, ne suspectus his foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:41" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n20640.16" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hoc est</orth> <itype>serves to annex a more particular explanation of what has been said</itype>, <hi rend="ital">that is</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that is to say</hi>, <hi rend="ital">namely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac causa dicam de eo prius, quod apud vos plurimum debet valere, hoc est, de voluntate eorum, quibus injuriae factae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadriennium, hoc est, ex quo tempore fundus veniit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 7, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">34, 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum honos agebatur amplissimus familiae vestrae, hoc est, consulatus parentis tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:17:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 17, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum quaero, qua ratione Naevius susceptum negotium non transegerit, hoc est, cur bona non vendiderit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 24, 76</bibl></cit> et saep.—Sarcastically: <cit><quote lang="la">ut haberet (Clodius) ad praeturam gerendam, hoc est, ad evertendam rem publicam plenum annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at quam crebro usurpat Et consul et Antonius! Hoc est dicere: Et consul et homo impudicissimus, Et consul et homo nequissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:28:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 28, 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20640.17" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hoc est</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrat</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quod</orth>, <itype>with the accessory idea of indignation or reproach</itype>, <hi rend="ital">is</hi> or <hi rend="ital">was it for this that</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc erat, alma parens, quod me per tela, per ignis Eripis, ut mediis hostem in penetralibus ... cernam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:664" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 664</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 93</bibl>.—Hence,</sense><sense id="n20640.18" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Advv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20640.19" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">hāc</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in this place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on this side</hi>, <hi rend="ital">this way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">here</hi> (class.): nunc Juppiter hac stat, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 263 Vahl.); imitated by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:565" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 565</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Ar.</hi> Hac quidem non venit. <hi rend="ital">Le.</hi> Angiporto Illac per hortum circuit clam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 151</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc hac An illac eam, incerta sum consili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plenus rimarum sum: hac atque illac perfluo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hac illac circumcursa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; and: mox hac <cb n="HICE" /> atque illa rapti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequere hac, reducam te ubi fuisti,</quote> <trans><tr>this way</tr>, <tr>hither</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 4, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 94</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sequere hac me intus ad Glycerium nunc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequere me ergo hac intro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">i hac mecum intro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:35 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 35 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin igitur ad illa spatia nostra pergimus? ... Nos vero: et hac quidem adire si placet, per ripam et umbram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab oppido declivis locus tenui fastigio vergebat. Hac nostris erat receptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:45:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 45, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 3</bibl>.—Hac-hac, for hac-illac (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">namque videbat, uti bellantes Pergama circum Hac fugerent Grai, Hac Phryges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:467 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 467 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 13</bibl>; rarely in full form with the interrog. particle <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum hacin feriam an ab laeva latus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 3, 10</bibl></cit> (cf. Ladewig, Anal. Scaen. p. 22). —</sense><sense id="n20640.20" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">hīc</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">heic</orth>; and with the interrog. part. <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">hicine</orth>), <hi rend="ital">adv. loci</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in this place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">here.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20640.21" n="I" level="1"> In space. </sense><sense id="n20640.22" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos quos videtis stare hic captivos duos, etc. ... Senex qui hic habitat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 1 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego jam dudum hic adsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem praestolare hic ante ostium?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic propter hunc adsiste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic tui omnes valent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo hic, ubi, etc.. . sed, ubicumque, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:55:section=143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 55, § 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons ibi arduus Nomine Parnasus ... hic ubi Deucalion ... parva rate vectus adhaesit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 319</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic (sc. Carthagine) illius (Junonis) arma, Hic currus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 16</bibl></cit> et saep.: <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Philocomasium hicine etiam nunc est? <hi rend="ital">Pe</hi> Quom exibam, hic erat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 25</bibl>; cf.: <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Ubi ego sum? hicine an apud mortuos? <hi rend="ital">Eut.</hi> Neque apud mortuos neque hic es, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hicine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:29 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 29 al.</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Da.</hi> Cedo fenus, redde fenus, fenus reddite, etc.... <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> Fenus illic, fenus hic, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile hic plus mali est, quam illic boni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic segetes, illic veniunt felicius uvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic, illic, ubi mors deprenderat, exhalantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:581" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 581</bibl></cit> (cf. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 519).—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic proxume viciniae,</quote> <trans><tr>in this neighborhood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo vidi virginem hic viciniae miseram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 45</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: hicine libertatem aiunt aequam esse omnibus? <hi rend="ital">is it here that</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 29</bibl> (cf. hic, I. B. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>).—</sense><sense id="n20640.23" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">in this affair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on this occasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in this particular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">herein</hi>, <hi rend="ital">here</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic, quantum in bello fortuna possit, cognosci potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 35, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:16:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 16, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic tu tabulas desideras Heracliensium publicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 4, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hic vos dubitabitis, judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:44:section=109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 44, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic miramur, hunc hominem tantum excellere ceteris? etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 13, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic jam plura non dicam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:41:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 41, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 66</bibl> (cf. II. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> infra): <cit><quote lang="la">hic, ubi opus est, non verentur: illic, ubi nihil opus est, ibi verentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cum hic tibi satisfecerimus, istic quoque nostram in te benevolentiam navare possimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 3</bibl></cit>.—Referring to the noun whose position in the sentence is the most remote (cf. I. D. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">alterius ducis causa melior videbatur, alterius erat firmior: hic omnia speciosa, illic valentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:49:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 49, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20640.24" n="II" level="1"> Of time, i. q. nunc or tum, <hi rend="ital">now</hi>, <hi rend="ital">here; then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hereupon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at this time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at this juncture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic reddes omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic ego quid praedicem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 10, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic cum uterque me intueretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hic cum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic tum Fabricius frequentes eos ad me domum adduxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:17:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 17, 49</bibl></cit>; so, hic tum, id. ib 20, 56; 27, 73; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26</bibl> § <cit><quote lang="la">66 al.: hic regina gravem poposcit pateram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:728" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 728</bibl></cit>.—So very freq. to introduce the beginning of a speech: hic Laelius (inquit); hic Philus; <cit><quote lang="la">hic Scipio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:13:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 13, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">24</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:50:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 50, 202</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 246</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n20640.25" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">huc</orth> (access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">hoc</orth>), v. huc.</sense></entryFree>
